Speaking to reporters after his release, Estrada said he is now a "free man," but assured that he would continue to attend hearings of his cases at the anti-graft court.
"'Pag punta ko dito (Sandiganbayan), wala nang guwardiya sa likod ko, sa harap ko, sa tagiliran ko. I'm a free man already but I will religiously attend the hearings of my plunder case," he said.

"I would like to thank our Lord God for giving me this opportunity. I would like to thank the magistrates of the Sandiganbayan for approving my petition for bail, and I would like to thank my family and supporters for their non-ending prayers for me," he added.
Asked who he will miss the most at his detention cell, Estrada responded: "Si Bong Revilla. Sino pa ba?"
Estrada said he is hopeful that Revilla, who is also on trial for his alleged role in the scam, would soon be released.
"Palakasin niya loob niya. Balang araw ay makakamit din niya ang kaniyang kalayaan," he said.
After his release, Estrada is expected to go home with his family in Quezon City.¬†
A thanksgiving mass is also scheduled Saturday afternoon at the Pinaglabanan Church in San Juan, the family's bailiwick.
Dating Sen. Jinggoy Estrada, nakapagpyansa na ng 1.33 million pesos sa kasong plunder at graft sa Sandiganbayan @DZMMTeleRadyo pic.twitter.com/w9IsjakCqZ
Earlier, Estrada's lawyer Alexis Suarez posted bail on his behalf at the Sandiganbayan past 9 a.m.
The anti-graft court had on Friday granted Estrada's motion for bail, set at P1 million for plunder and P330,000 for 11 counts of graft, at P30,000 each.

He had been detained at the Philippine National Police headquarters in Camp Crame since 2014 on allegations that he pocketed P183 million in kickbacks from fake projects, purportedly with help from businesswoman Janet Lim Napoles, the alleged scam mastermind.
Estrada is among three former senators tagged in the scam, along ¬†with Revilla and Juan Ponce Enrile, who was released on bail in 2015.

abs-cbn.title: Kaso ng notoryus na 'rapist' sa Isabela, tinutukan ng SOCO
content: Kinatakutan sa lugar ng Isabela ang 51-anyos na si Orlino Gapusan dahil sa pag-iiba ng ugali nito tuwing nalalagay sa impluwensiya ng alak.¬†
Base sa kuwento ng ilang mga residente, kapag nalalasing si Gapusan ay lumalabas umano ang pagkahilig nito sa mga babae, kahit pa menor de edad ang mga ito.
"'Yung mga dalaga, gusto [nila siya] i-barangay kasi mahilig talaga sa mga bata. Bale tatlo 'yung nag-reklamo sa akin," kuwento ng barangay captain ng lugar na si Roel Quebral.
"Parang nakukulitan 'yung mga bata kasi [lagi siyang] bumabalik na lasing. Gusto niya raw ikasal do'n sa gusto niyang babae kaso nga umaayaw kasi medyo matanda na [si Gapusan]."
Madalas nang nairereklamo sa barangay si Gapusan pero wala raw may lakas ng loob na pormal na magsampa ng kaso ng pangmomolestiya.
Batid naman ni Quebral ang pagiging notoryus ni Gapusan.
"Minsan pinaikot ko 'yung tanod kasi nung minsang nalasing 'yan eh naghahamon daw. Nag-aamok siya. May bato o may pamalo," kuwento ni Quebral.
"Sumisigaw na wala daw kinatatakutan dito, kahit daw ako. Talagang may pagkabarumbado."
Kabilang na sa mga nakursunadahan ni Gapusan ang 17-taong gulang na anak ni Estanislao Costales na si alyas "Lisa."
Sa salaysay ng dalaga, hapon noong Hunyo 26, 2013 nang pagsamantalahan siya ni Gapusan.
"Hawak niya 'yung baril kaya 'yung bata nanahimik. Pinagbantaan siya na papatayin kaming lahat ‚Äòpag nagsumbong siya," ani Costales.
"Hindi niya sinasabi sa amin 'yung ginawa ni Orlino, 'yung nangyari sa kanyang pag-rape," dagdag niya.
Dahil sa pangyayaring ito, naging masama ang reputasyon ni Gapusan.

"Siyempre nung nalaman [ng mga tao na] nang-rape, ayaw na [nilang] makipag-usap sa kanya. 'Yung mga dalaga, pinipilit niyang [ipasyal] pero ayaw na nung dalaga kasi manyakis nga. Kaya natakot din sila baka makita [nila si Orlino],‚Äù sabi ni Quebral.

Ngunit bumalik sa dating gawi si Gapusan nang muli itong malasing. Maging ang pamilya ni Lisa ay nalagay sa kapahamakan.
¬†
Sundan ang buong kuwento sa ABS-CBN SOCO (Scene of the Crime Operatives) ngayong Sabado, 4 p.m. pagkatapos ng ‚ÄúIpaglaban Mo!‚Äù sa ABS-CBN.

abs-cbn.title: Jinggoy Estrada leaves detention
content: MANILA - After more than three years in detention, former Sen. Jinggoy Estrada left the Philippine National Police Custodial Center in Camp Crame after posting a P1.33-million bail for his alleged role in the multibillion-peso "pork barrel" scam.
As of this posting, Estrada, still with police escorts, was being transported to the Sandiganbayan, where he would undergo processing for his official release.¬†
Wearing a pink shirt, blue jacket and shades, he waved from an open window of the coaster.¬†
After his release, Estrada is expected to go home with his family in Quezon City.¬†
A thanksgiving mass is also scheduled Saturday afternoon at the Pinaglabanan Church in San Juan, the family's bailiwick.
Dating Sen. Jinggoy Estrada, nakapagpyansa na ng 1.33 million pesos sa kasong plunder at graft sa Sandiganbayan @DZMMTeleRadyo pic.twitter.com/w9IsjakCqZ
Earlier, Estrada's lawyer Alexis Suarez posted bail on his behalf at the Sandiganbayan past 9 a.m.
The anti-graft court had on Friday granted Estrada's motion for bail, set at P1 million for plunder and P330,000 for 11 counts of graft, at P30,000 each.

He had been detained at the Philippine National Police headquarters in Camp Crame since 2014 on allegations that he pocketed P183 million in kickbacks from fake projects, purportedly with help from businesswoman Janet Lim Napoles, the alleged scam mastermind.

Estrada is among three former senators tagged in the scam, along¬†
with Senators Bong Revilla and Juan Ponce Enrile.
Enrile was released on bail in 2015, while Revilla remains detained while on trial.¬†

abs-cbn.title: New DSWD Usec Ilagan vows to continue Taguiwalo's programs
content: DAVAO CITY ‚Äì Days after President Rodrigo Duterte signed her appointment papers, newly-named Department of Social Welfare and Development (DSWD) Undersecretary Luzviminda Ilagan vowed to continue programs initiated by former Secretary Judy Taguiwalo, a fellow activist.
Ilagan, a former Gabriela party-list Representative, stressed the importance of continuing efforts by Taguiwalo, especially those catering to the poor.
Taguiwalo had left her post in August after she was rejected by the Commission on Appointments. Duterte has yet to name a replacement.¬†

"Nakita man gyud natu ang dedikasyon ni Judy unsa gyud kakugihan ang iyahang pagtrabaho so angay ipadayon na. Unfortunately, wala lang siya na-confirm sa Commission on Appointments. Sa karon, dili man pud logical nga molihis sa mandatu sa DSWD," Ilagan said.

(We saw how dedicated and hardworking Judy was, so I want to continue her legacy. Unfortunately, the Commission on Appointments did not confirm her. For now, it would not be logical to deviate from the DSWD's mandate.)

Duterte appointed Ilagan, his fellow Davao native, to the DSWD post on Sept. 13. She is a staunch supporter of the President, coming to his defense when the then President-elect drew flak for catcalling a female journalist in May last year.
Ilagan had served as Davao City Councilor upon the appointment of the late former President Corazon Aquino in 1986, when Duterte was the appointed Davao City Vice Mayor.¬†
She was elected to the same post in 1998, but lost her return bid when she again ran for councilor in 2016.

abs-cbn.title: Aabot sa 10-talampakang sawa, natagpuan sa Malabon
content: MALABON CITY ‚Äì Nagulat ang isang residente at ang anak nito nang may makitang malaking ahas sa loob ng kanilang bahay.
Bandang alas-2 ng madaling araw ay magluluto daw sana ng paninda ang anak ni Azusena Rodico nang makita ang isang sawa sa kisame ng bahay nila sa Barangay Potrero dito.
Ayon kay Rodico, mahigit-kumulang 10 talampakan ang haba ng ahas.
‚ÄúNagsisigaw nga 'yung anak ko eh. Sinarado raw iyong pintuan, baka makalabas,‚Äù ani Rodico.
Tinawag niya si Rogelio Cabanban, ang kaniyang kapitbahay, para magpatulong na alisin ang sawa. Ngunit tinuklaw ito matapos umanong saksakin ang ahas ng kutsilyo.
Hindi naman siya nangailangan ng anti-venom, dahil ang kagat ng mga sawa o python ay hindi nakalalason.
Makalipas ang ilang minuto ay dumating na ang mga opisyal ng barangay, at nagtulong-tulong sa pagtali sa bibig ng sawa at pagsilid nito sa sako.
Ayon kay Henry Ranay, executive officer ng Barangay Potrero, maaaring sa katabing ilog nanggaling ang sawa.
‚ÄúMaaari pong sa ilog nanggaling 'yun. Umahon lang, kasi tabing ilog 'yung bahay,‚Äù aniya.
Dinala ang sawa sa malapit na wildlife rescue center na nakarehistro sa Bureau of Animal Industry.

abs-cbn.title: Construction worker patay matapos barilin sa labas ng bahay
content: MANILA - Patay ang isang construction worker matapos barilin ng hindi pa nakikilalang salarin sa lungsod ng Taguig, Biyernes ng gabi.¬†
Nagtamo ng isang tama ng bala sa dibdib ang 35-anyos na biktima na si Jessie Castrisiones.
Ayon sa paunang impormasyon, nasa loob ng bahay umano si Castrisiones nang ayain ng isang lalaki na lumabas.

Makalipas ang ilang minuto ay nakarinig na ng isang putok ng baril ang mga residente sa Pinamana Site, Purok 7, Barangay Napindan. Natagpuan na lang sa madilim na parte ng naturang lugar ang biktima na nakabulagta.

Napag-alaman na may nakaalitan itong kapatid dahil sa pagbebenta ng lupa. Madalas din umano itong ireklamo ng mga kapitbahay lalo na kapag nalalasing ay naghahamon ng away. Kabilang rin sa drug watch list ng barangay ang biktima bilang isang user.

abs-cbn.title: 4 arestado sa drug bust sa QC
content: 4 suspects, including 1 minor arrested in separate drug buy bust operations in Quezon City pic.twitter.com/ue7SrOUB21
MANILA - Apat na katao, kabilang ang isang menor de edad, ang arestado sa magkakahiwalay na buy-bust operation sa Quezon City.
Bandang ala-1 ng madaling araw ng Sabado, isang informant ng Batasan Police ang nagpanggap na buyer ng halagang P500 na shabu mula kay Cristina Mendoza sa Sto. Ni√±o Street, Barangay Payatas.
Kasama ni Mendoza noon ang umano‚Äôy buyer na si Mark Isagani Soliman at ang 6-taong gulang na batang umano‚Äôy runner.
Dinala ang tatlo sa Batasan Police Station.

Narekober mula sa operasyon ang tatlong sachet ng shabu na tinatayang nagkakahalaga ng P10,000.
¬†
Timbog naman sa isa pang buy-bust operation sa Kalayaan Street, Barangay Batasan Hills ang 30-taong gulang na si Mark Soriano.
Nakuha mula sa kanya ang tatlong sachet ng shabu at isang 38-caliber revolver.
Ayon sa impormasyon ng pulis, dati nang nakulong si Soriano dahil sa snatching.
Sasampahan ng kasong paglabag sa Comprehensive Dangerous Drugs Act ang tatlong suspect na nasa hustong edad.¬†
Ang menor de edad naman ay ire-refer sa Department of Social Welfare and Development. Posibleng ang kanyang mga magulang ang sampahan ng kaso.

abs-cbn.title: Computer technician, patay matapos pagbabarilin sa Tondo
content: 24-anyos na lalaki, patay sa pamamaril sa Quirino St., Bgy. 107, Tondo, Maynila pic.twitter.com/TWaC9NNxkr
MANILA - Patay ang isang 24-anyos na computer technician matapos pagbabarilin ng mga 'di pa nakikilalang salarin sa Barangay 107, Tondo, Maynila, hatinggabi ng Sabado.
Bumulagta matapos pagbabarilin sa harap ng isang bahay sa Quirino Street si Angelo Enriquez na nakasuot ng jersey at sombrero.¬†

Narinig ng mga taga-roon ang nasa limang putok ng baril mula sa apat na salarin na sakay ng dalawang motorsiklo. Nakaputing face mask at itim na suot ang mga ito. Agad silang tumakas matapos ang pamamaril.
Taga-ibang lugar si Enriquez. Ayon sa isang tiyuhin niyang napasugod sa crime scene, pasaway at matigas umano ang ulo ng biktima, pero hindi niya sinabi kung ano ang ginawa nito.
Hindi rin alam ng tiyuhin kung sangkot si Enriquez sa ilegal na gawain.
Ayon sa kaanak, may dalawang batang anak ang biktima sa dating kinakasama.
Narekober ng Scene of the Crime Operatives ang nasa 7 basyo ng bala sa crime scene. Iniimbestigahan pa ang motibo sa pamamaril.

abs-cbn.title: Jinggoy Estrada posts bail, to be released
content: MANILA (UPDATE) - Former Sen. Jinggoy Estrada is expected to be released Saturday after posting bail for plunder and graft charges in connection with his alleged involvement in the multibillion-peso "pork barrel" scam.
Dating Sen. Jinggoy Estrada, nakapagpyansa na ng 1.33 million pesos sa kasong plunder at graft sa Sandiganbayan @DZMMTeleRadyo pic.twitter.com/w9IsjakCqZ
"We are thankful and glad to the court that the bail was granted," said Estrada's lawyer Alexis Suarez.
Suarez went to the Sandiganbayan past 9 a.m. and posted bail worth P1.33 million.¬†
"They will secure a release order and then dadalhin sa Camp Crame, and then they will bring him here. Kailangan niya mag-finger printing. It's a process," Suarez told reporters at the Sandiganbayan.
TINGNAN: Release Order para kay dating Sen. Jinggoy Estrada, inilabas na ng Sandiganbayan | via @zhandercayabyab pic.twitter.com/YlxwAF2sMT
TINGNAN: Resibo ng P1.33 milyon na piyansa ni dating Sen. Jinggoy Estrada sa Sandiganbayan | via @zhandercayabyab pic.twitter.com/VxUg6MIVni
Estrada will continue to attend hearings at the anti-graft court while out on bail, the lawyer said.¬†
"The trial will continue. Actually, there will be a trial scheduled on Monday, and then the graft also will also continue. He will be attending those trials," she said.
The Sandiganbayan had on Friday granted Estrada's motion for bail, set at P1 million for plunder and P330,000 for 11 counts of graft, at P30,000 each.
He is expected to be released within the day, ending three years of incarceration.

Estrada had been detained at the Philippine National Police headquarters in Camp Crame since 2014 on allegations that he pocketed P183 million in kickbacks from fake projects, purportedly with help from businesswoman Janet Lim Napoles, the alleged scam mastermind.

Earlier, the senator's wife Precy said Estrada will first go to their Quezon City home after his release. He and his family are then expected to go to his father Manila Mayor Joseph Estrada's house for lunch.
A thanksgiving mass is also scheduled at 3 p.m. on Saturday at the Pinaglabanan Shrine in San Juan, the family's bailiwick, she said.¬†

"He was saying last night that during the last day of Senate he didn't have the opportunity to thank his constituents so maybe that's the first thing that he will do. He will go around the country and it will be an opportunity for him to thank his supporters," she said.
Estrada is among three former senators tagged in the scam, along with Senators Bong Revilla and Juan Ponce Enrile.
Enrile was released on bail in 2015, while Revilla remains detained while on trial.¬†

abs-cbn.title: Civil service official shot dead in Tuguegarao
content: TUGUEGARAO CITY ‚Äî A Civil Service Commission official in Region 2 was killed in Barangay Centro 10 here on Friday.
Investigation showed that lawyer and regional director Neil Agustin was driving his car when he was shot dead by motorcycle-riding assailants along Gonzaga Street extension.
Agustin's employee, Randolph Castaneda, was with him during the incident. Castaneda said he got out of their vehicle and ran for safety after the gunmen sped off.
Police Sr. Supt. Warren Tolito said a special task group has been formed to look into the case.
Tuguegarao police and nearby stations have placed checkpoints around the area.

abs-cbn.title: Grupo ng mga manggagawa, naliliitan sa umento sa sahod
content: Hindi kuntento ang isang labor group sa inaprubahang umento sa sahod para sa mga manggagawa ng National Capital Region. Napakaliit umano ng P21 na wage hike, lalo't tumaas ang singil sa kuryente, tubig at petrolyo. I-Bandila mo, Zen Hernandez. - Bandila, Biyernes, 15 Setyembre, 2017

Ikinakasa na rin ng ilang grupo ang isang malakihang kilos protesta sa anibersaryo ng martial law sa September 21. I-Bandila mo, DZMM Radyo Patrol Michael Delizo. - Bandila sa DZMM, Biyernes, 15 Setyembre, 2017

abs-cbn.title: Binatilyong natagpuang patay sa Bulacan, isinailalim sa autopsy
content: Sumailalim sa autopsy nitong Biyernes ang bangkay ng lalaking natagpuang nakasilid sa sako sa isang sapa sa San Jose del Monte, Bulacan.
Siniyasat ng medico legal ng Public Attorney‚Äôs Office ang bangkay ni Michael Remecio sa opisina nila sa Quezon City.
Alas-sais ng gabi nang dumating sa tahanan ng pamilya Remecio sina Attorney Persida Acosta at kinausap ang mga magulang ni Michael para magpaalam na ma-eksamin ang labi.
Base sa paunang obserbasiyon sa retrato ng bangkay, tila nasaksak ito. Inalam din ng medico legal kung si Michael nga ito.¬†
Dahil matagal lumabas ang resulta ng DNA test, titingnan nila ang dental records ng bata at ikukumpara sa bangkay.
Inalam din kung may previous injuries ang kanilang anak dahil pwede itong pagbasehan ng pagkakakilanlan. Ayon sa mga magulang, dating na-operahan ang biktima sa kanyang appendix at nabalian ng braso.
Tumulong naman ang lokal na pamahalaan sa pamilya Remecio at sinagot ang gastusin sa burol at libing ni Michael.
--Ulat ni Jeck Batallones, ABS-CBN News

abs-cbn.title: Bagong testigo sa kaso ni Carl Arnaiz, iba ang pahayag sa taxi driver
content: May bagong testigo sa kaso ng pagpatay kay Carl Angelo Arnaiz at handa siyang makipagtulungan sa imbestigasiyon. Exclusive, i-Bandila mo, Niko Baua. - Bandila sa DZMM, Biyernes, 15 Setyembre, 2017

abs-cbn.title: Jinggoy Estrada, pinayagan na magpiyansa
content: Pinayagan na ng Sandiganbayan na magpiyansa si dating senador Jinggoy Estrada. Kaugnay ito sa plunder case na nakasampa laban sa kanya. Mula sa may Camp Crame sa Quezon City, i-Bandila mo, Miguel Dumaual. - Bandila sa DZMM, Biyernes, 15 Setyembre, 2017

abs-cbn.title: Dinagat Islands health officer, patay sa pamamaril
content: Patay ang provincial health officer ng Dinagat Islands matapos barilin ng hindi pa kilalang gunman sa Barangay New Mabuhay, sa bayan ng Dinagat ngayong Huwebes.
Kinilala ang biktima na si Dr. Vicente Soco na nanonood lang ng balita sa telebisiyon nang pagbabarilin siya ng hindi pa kilalang salarin, ayon sa pulisya.
Ayon sa imbestigasiyon, pasado 7 p.m. nang marinig ang putok ng armas sa loob ng gasolinahang pagmamay-ari ng biktima.¬†
Nakatakas umano ang salarin sakay ng isang motor, dagdag ng pulisya.
Ayon sa mga awtoridad, wala pang malinaw na motibo sa pagpatay sa doktor. Galing umano ito sa isang medical mission sa Barangay Borja, Cagdianao, Dinagat Islands sa araw ng pamamaril.
Isinugod ang biktima sa isang ospital sa Surigao City pero binawian din ng buhay.

content: Iginiit ni Defense Secretary Delfin Lorenzana na malabong magdeklara si Pangulong Duterte ng martial law sa buong bansa. Binatikos din ng Malaca√±ang ang maling interpretasyon ng ilang news organization sa mga naging pahayag ng pangulo. i-Bandila mo, Bettina Magsaysay. - Bandila, Biyernes, 15 Setyembre, 2017

Sa pahayag ng ABS-CBN, sinabi nitong pinayagan si Araullo na ituloy ang interes sa film, broadcast at digital media. Hangad ng ABS-CBN ang tagumpay ni Araullo at mananatili ang turing sa kanya bilang Kapamilya. Nagpa-Patrol, Marie Lozano. TV Patrol, Biyernes, Setyembre 15, 2017

Paliwanag ng pulisya, bahagi ito ng kanilang oplan bakal at iginiit na may koordinasyon sila sa mga opisyal ng barangay at asosasyon ng bar owners. Nagpa-Patrol, Miguel Dumaual. abs-cbn.title: Ilang pabahay para sa mga biktima ng Yolanda, tinawag na ‚Äòsubstandard‚Äô
content: Nagdadalawang-isip ang ilang Yolanda survivors sa Eastern Samar na lumipat sa mga ibibigay na pabahay ng National Housing Authority. Lumalabas kasi sa imbestigasiyon ng Committee on Housing and Urban Development ng Kongreso na substandard ang ilang pabahay. Nagpa-Patrol, Ranulfo Docdocan. TV Patrol, Biyernes, 15 Setyembre 2017

abs-cbn.title: Isyu ng ‚Äòlove triangle‚Äô at droga, tinitingnang motibo sa pagpaslang kay Michael Remecio
content: Iniimbestigahan ng mga pulis ang anggulong ‚Äúlove triangle‚Äù at droga kaugnay sa pagpatay sa 16-anyos na si Michael Angelo Remecio.¬†

Ayon kay Genevie Remecio, ina ni Michael, malakas ang kutob niya na may kinalaman sa pagkamatay ng kanyang anak ang isang alyas "Kim," na umano'y amo ni Michael sa Bulacan at "bino-boyfriend-boyfriend" daw ang anak.

Kuwento ng kaibigan ni Michael, na kinilala lamang sa pangalang ‚ÄúJoshua,‚Äù gabi ng Setyembre 1 habang namamasada siya ng tricycle sa Obando, Bulacan, ay nadaanan niyang nakatambay sa isang tindahan si Michael at niyaya niya itong umuwi kasabay niya.

Pero hindi sumama si Michael at sinabing may tampo raw ito sa kanyang ina at sinabing pansamantala raw siyang nakikituloy sa kanyang amo. Bagama‚Äôt ayon sa ina ni Michael, wala itong nakikitang dahilan para maglayas ang anak noong Agosto 26.

Samantala, ayon kay alyas "Bhakz," isa sa mga kaibigan ni Michael, humingi pa umano ng saklolo sa kanila si Michael noong Setyembre 10 sa pamamagitan ng Facebook. Hindi na raw kasi ito makauwi dahil sa pagbabanta ng kanyang amo.
Ayon sa kaibigan ng pamilya Remecio, mayroong girlfriend si Michael.
Hindi naman matanggap ng ina ni Michael na baka dahil lang sa "selos" ang motibo sa pagpaslang sa kanyang anak.
Sinabi rin ni Bhakz na sangkot umano sa droga ang amo ni Michael, sabay giit na wala aniya silang kaibigang adik.
Paliwanag ng mga pulis, talamak daw kasi ang bentahan ng droga sa lugar kung saan huling nakita si Michael.
Pero nilinaw na ng mga magulang ni Michael na hindi nagdodroga ang kanilang anak.
Ayon naman sa isang malapit na kaibigan ng pamilya Remecio, posibleng kilala ng ilan sa mga kaibigan ni Michael ang itinuturong pumaslang sa bata.
Hindi pa lumalabas ang autopsy report dahil, ayon sa Philippine National Police‚ÄîBulacan, baka isabay na nila ito sa paglabas ng resulta ng DNA test.
-- Ulat nina Angel Movido at Jeck Batallones, ABS-CBN News

abs-cbn.title: Ilang mga preso sa Baguio, abala sa bagong bukas na salon
content: Pinagkakakitaan ng mga preso sa Baguio city jail ang bagong bukas na salon at spa na matatagpuan sa loob ng female dorm ng kulungan.
Ito ang bagong pinagkakaabalahan ng mga inmate na nagustuhan naman ng kanilang mga customer.
Kahit na ilang araw pa lang na nagbubukas ang salon, marami na ang dumadayo rito dahil mura at maganda rin umano ang kanilang mga serbisyo.
Gaya ng karaniwang salon at spa, kabilang sa kanilang serbisyo ay ang mga sumusunod:

Hair rebond: P400-P600
Hair dye: P150-P250
Hot oil: P150-P250
Cellophane: P200-P300
Facial: P200
Body scrub: P250
Body massage: P250
Foot spa: P200
Hand spa: P100
Blow dry: P30
Hair press: P50
Hair trim: P80
Eyebrow threading: P30
Manicure: P50
Pedicure: P50
Si Elisa Chan, sinubukan ang serbisyo ng mga preso sa bagong salon at sinabing mura lang ang naging bayad niya, kumpara raw sa iba na mahal ang singil.
Dagdag niya, mahusay ang serbisyong ibinibigay ng mga preso at alagang-alaga nila siya.
Tiniyak din ng mga inmate na may sapat silang kaalaman sa mga trabaho sa salon at spa habang malaking bahagi ng kita ng negosyo ay napupunta sa mga nagtatrabahong inmate.
Ang iba naman ay nag-aambag para sa pangkalahatang gastusin ng female dorm.
Ang ibang mga inmate na hindi nagtatrabaho sa spa, abala naman sa paggagantsilyo, pananahi at paggawa ng iba pang handicrafts.
-- Ulat ni Mae Cornes, ABS-CBN News

abs-cbn.title: Metro Manila workers to get pay hike
content: Minimum-wage earners in Metro Manila are set to get a P21 increase in their paychecks, but a labor group said the wage hike will not bring much relief due to the rising cost of commodities and services. More from Zen Hernandez. - Business Nightly, ANC, September 15, 2017

abs-cbn.title: Alvarez denies asking for Gascon‚Äôs resignation before restoring CHR budget
content: House Speaker Pantaleon Alvarez denied he asked for the resignation of Commission on Human Rights (CHR) chair Chito Gascon before Congress restores the commission's budget. He also cautioned the Senate against moving too quickly to grant the CHR a budget bigger than the P1,000 allocated by the Lower House. More from RG Cruz. ‚Äì The World Tonight, ANC, September 15, 2017

abs-cbn.title: Duterte: Trillanes ‚Äòaccumulated‚Äô money during backchannel talks with China
content: MANILA‚ÄîPresident Rodrigo Duterte on Friday said Senator Antonio Trillanes IV earned money during his backdoor negotiations with China in the 2012 Scarborough Shoal standoff.
‚ÄúHe was going back or forth, 8 or 9 times sa China tapos iyon iyong nag-accumulate ang pera niya. That‚Äôs the time we lost the Scarborough Shoal,‚Äù Duterte alleged in an interview aired on PTV4.
Duterte added that, even if Trillanes signed bank-secrecy waivers, the accounts could not be opened if his co-depositors would not do the same thing.
‚ÄúEven if he waives everything there, iyong co-partner niyang mga Chinese for every bank, 'pag hindi nagbigay ng waiver, you cannot open the account," he said.
The president further detailed Trillanes‚Äô offshore bank accounts from a foreign report.
‚ÄúYou know, according to this report from another country, hindi ito atin, Trillanes has several currency accounts in Shanghai, Zurich, Geneva and Singapore,‚Äù Duterte said.

‚ÄúAll foreign accounts of Trillanes were flagged as having international transactions. Aside from the accounts in Asia and Switzerland, he has savings accounts in Cayman Islands which were opened online, British Virgin Islands.‚Äù
DUTERTE 'KEEPS ON BURYING HIMSELF IN LIES'
Trillanes refuted Duterte's allegation that he accumulated money during his trips to China.
"As for the Scarborough Shoal issue, binasura na ng Ombudsman ang kaso na yan na base lamang sa conspiracy theory ni Enrile," Trillanes said in a text message to ABS-CBN News.

In June, the Ombudsman junked treason charges against former President Benigno Aquino III and Trillanes in the wake of backchannel talks with China in connection with territorial disputes in the West Philippine Sea.
Trillanes also belied the president's claim on the bank-secrecy waivers he signed and said the Anti-Money Laundering Council could access single and joint foreign accounts.

"Duterte just keeps on burying himself in lies. As I keep on stressing, AMLC has the power to access foreign accounts either held singly or jointly. That's why I signed those waivers unconditionally," he said.
Trillanes challenged Duterte to sign bank-secrecy waivers anew to open his Bank of the Philippine Islands accounts.
He also called out the president for "being mum" on his son and Davao City Vice Mayor Paolo Duterte's alleged involvement in an illegal-drug organization.
"At bakit wala syang imik sa pagiging myembro ni Polong sa Triad na syang dahilan kung bakit bilyon bilyong pisong shabu ang pumapasok sa ating bansa?" Trillanes said.
Duterte and Trillanes have been going back and forth recently, alleging that the other has hidden wealth deposited in their bank accounts.
Trillanes earlier reiterated his allegation that Duterte has billions of pesos in the bank after the president called him ‚Äúpolitical ISIS.‚Äù
Duterte hit back and claimed that Trillanes shares his alleged offshore bank accounts with a Chinese national.

abs-cbn.title: Hepe ng CHR Negros, may sarkastikong sagot sa P1,000 pondo para sa ahensiya
content: Balak magbenta ng mani at fish ball ni Jess Ca√±ete, hepe ng Commission on Human Rights Negros Oriental, upang ipakita ang pagkadismaya sa naging desisyon ng Kamara sa inilaang P1,000 pondo sa ahensiya.
Ayon sa nakasulat sa karatulang ginawa ni Ca√±ete, tumatanggap siya ng labada at puwede ring malapitan bilang "orasyon bisaya" o albularyo.

Paliwanag ni Ca√±ete, ang ginawa niya ay isang paraan upang iprotesta ang mababang pondo sa ahensiya. Dagdag pa niya, isa itong sarkastikong pagpapahayag laban sa pang-iinsulto ng Kamara sa kanilang ahensiya.
Nitong Martes, pumabor ang mababang kapulungan na maglaan ng P1,000 pondo para sa CHR para sa susunod na taon.
May 119 na kongresista ang pumabor sa naturang budget, habang 32 naman ang hindi pumabor.
Banat ni House Speaker Pantaleon Alvarez, hindi umano ginagawa ng ahensiya ang kanilang trabaho kaya bakit aniya magsasayang ng pera ang gobyerno sa ahensiya.
Iginiit din niya na pinoprotektahan lamang ng CHR ang karapatang-pantao ng mga kriminal at ipinagwawalang-bahala ang mga inosenteng biktima ng krimen.
Bagama't pagtatanggol ng ahensiya, ang mandato ng CHR ay ang imbestigahan ang mga posibleng pang-aabuso ng mga opisyal ng gobyerno.

Samantala, ayon kay Ramon Casiple, executive director ng Institute for Political and Electoral Reform, maaaring singilin sa susunod na eleksyon ang mga kongresistang bumoto pabor sa P1,000 pondo ng ahensiya.
Sa kabila ng naging desisyon ng Kamara, nagpahayag ang ilang senador na susuporta sila sa pagtaguyod ng makatarungang pondo para sa ahensiya.
Ang CHR ay isa sa mga aktibong kritiko ng admistrasyon kaugnay sa kampanya kontra ilegal na droga at ilang beses na ring pinasaringan ni Pangulong Rodrigo Duterte sa kanyang mga talumpati.

abs-cbn.title: 2 menor de edad, timbog matapos gamiting drug courier ng ama
content: Arestado ang magkapatid na menor de edad na ginagamit umano ng sariling ama bilang drug courier, sa buy-bust operation na ikinasa ng Sta. Maria Police nitong Huwebes.
Narekober sa mga bata ang 37 gramo ng shabu na may market value na P214,000.
Ayon sa pulisya, target talaga ng kanilang operasyon ang ama ng dalawang bata pero nagulat sila na ang mga menor de edad ang pinagdala ng droga.
‚ÄúAng ama nila ay isinubo itong dalawang bata para i-deliver iyong droga doon sa operatiba natin. Siyempre para makaiwas sa pagka-aresto,‚Äù ani Supt. Raniel Valones.
Kuwento ng dalawang bata sa news team, dalawang beses na silang pinagdala ng shabu ng kanilang tatay sa mga binebentahan niya ng droga.¬†
Nakatakas naman ang tatay ng mga bata habang nakakulong ang kanilang nanay sa ibang kaso.¬†
Nitong Agosto 31 lamang, nahuli rin ang dalawang itinuturong supplier ng ama ng dalawang naarestong bata.¬†

Samantala, nakatakdang dalhin ng Sta. Maria, Bulacan‚ÄîPhilippine National Police (PNP) sa Department of Social Welfare and Development ang magkapatid na naaresto habang pinaghahanap pa ang kanilang tatay na nagdawit sa kanila sa kalakaran ng ilegal na droga.
Nababahala ang mga pulis lalo‚Äôt mga bata na ang ginagamit sa ilegal na droga.
Sa datos ng Bulacan PNP mula Hulyo 1, 2016, hanggang Setyembre 15, 2017, umabot na sa higit 60 na menor de edad ang naaresto sa mga drug operation.¬†
Higit 355 naman na mga menor de edad ang sumuko sa mga Oplan Tokhang.¬†
-- Ulat ni Doland Castro, ABS-CBN News

abs-cbn.title: New Arnaiz slay witness' testimony differs from taxi driver's
content: A new witness to Carl Arnaiz‚Äôs killing surfaced and offered an account of what happened, which was different from that of taxi driver Tomas Bagcal. ABS-CBN News also obtained a copy of a CCTV video that corroborates the new witness' statements. Niko Baua has this exclusive. ‚Äì The World Tonight, ANC, September 15, 2017

abs-cbn.title: Caloocan bishop on city cops' relief: Praise the lord!
content: MANILA - Caloocan Bishop Pablo Virgilio David could not help but praise the heavens after the relief of the entire Caloocan police amid several criminal allegations against them, including teen killings and a robbery.¬†
"Praise the Lord," the bishop said in an interview with Radio Veritas.¬†

The prelate said that removing the officers from their posts and retraining them would not be enough. He said appropriate charges should also be filed against those proven to have abused their authority.¬†

"This is the only way the PNP (Philippine National Police) can protect the integrity of the whole police institution: by disciplining their own ranks and following only just and lawful orders from their superiors," David said.¬†

NCRPO chief Oscar Albayalde had ordered the relief of 62 Caloocan City police officers and the retraining of 1,000 Caloocan police personnel after several of its officers were tagged in teen killings and a robbery.¬†
He said the vacant police posts may be filled by personnel from the Regional Public Safety Battalion.
Caloocan police officers are accused of killing 17-year-old Kian Loyd delos Santos, 19-year-old Carl Angelo Arnaiz, and 14-year-old Reynaldo De Guzman in separate incidents.

Delos Santos, who police tagged in illegal drugs, was slain in an anti-narcotics sweep in Caloocan City on Aug. 16, after allegedly shooting at pursuing officers. Arnaiz was meanwhile killed on Aug. 18 when he allegedly robbed a taxi driver, also in Caloocan.¬†
Their families dispute police amid witness statements and forensic evidence suggesting they were murdered.¬†

A witness who recently surfaced meanwhile saw De Guzman, 14, with Arnaiz, and several Caloocan police officers in a cab on the night of the latter's death. The two had left their Cainta, Rizal neighborhood together on Aug. 17.¬†
De Guzman's parents assert that the body found in Gapan, Nueva Ecija, with multiple stab wounds and head wrapped in tape, is their son, despite a police DNA test showing a negative match.
Meanwhile, Caloocan police were also tagged in breaking into a house on Sept. 7, stealing valuables and cash totaling P30,000.
END THE CYCLE
Bishop David also called on families of the victims, as well as witnesses to the killings, to stand their ground in their quest for justice.¬†
He said this is the only way to stop the cycle of violence and hold those involved accountable.¬†

"The witnesses and families of other victims should come out, file cases, and testify in order to make sure their abusers are not just going to be transferred to other stations. Otherwise, they‚Äôll just do the same things over and over again," the prelate warned.
The Catholic Church in the Philippines has been a voice of opposition to the the government's bloody campaign against illegal drugs.¬†
The country's bishops conference has been issuing statements condemning the killings allegedly perpetuated by the police.¬†
But the government has repeatedly denied it was behind slays of drug suspects. President Rodrigo Duterte has also promised justice for the recent teen deaths.

abs-cbn.title: Palace: Duterte to skip UN assembly to deal with Marawi crisis
content: MANILA‚Äî Malaca√±ang on Friday said President Rodrigo Duterte will skip the United Nations (UN) General Assembly set later this month to attend to the ongoing crisis in Marawi City.
In a statement, Presidential spokesperson Ernesto Abella said Duterte has decided to lessen foreign travels to deal with the country‚Äôs issues.
"The President has stated that he would minimize foreign travels for now to attend to pressing domestic concerns, such as the rehabilitation of Marawi,‚Äù the statement read.

Fighting between state troops and Islamic State-linked terrorists have been raging for nearly four months in Marawi City, leaving at least 845 dead, most of them terrorists, and hundreds of thousands displaced.
The prolonged conflict has left much of the once bustling urban center ravaged, and the government has begun plans for its rehabilitation.¬†

¬†
Abella's announcement came shortly after a tense exchange between the world body and the administration over Duterte's drug war.¬†

On Tuesday, UN High Commissioner for Human Rights Zeid Ra'ad Al Hussein expressed concern over drug-related killings in the Philippines, saying the anti-drug campaign's ‚Äúlack of respect for due process rights of all Filipinos is appalling."
Foreign Affairs Secretary Alan Peter Cayetano hit back and said the commissioner‚Äôs remark ‚Äúseverely mischaracterized‚Äù the human rights situation in the Philippines.

"The Commissioner‚Äôs report would have been balanced and accurate had he considered the information that we provided, instead of just relying on uncorroborated information," Cayetano said in a statement.
Earlier, the President lashed out at UN Special Rapporteur on Extrajudicial, Summary and Arbitrary Executions Agnes Callamard for opposing his campaign against illegal drugs.
"French? T*** i**, umuwi siya doon. (Son of a b****. She should just go home)," Duterte was quoted as saying in a news report.
Callamard has been critical of slays under Duterte's watch and had sought a visit to the country to investigate drug-related killings.
The administration last year invited Callamard, but she declined due to conditions it set, including a public debate with Duterte that she said would violate UN protocols.
She visited Manila in May to attend an academic conference on drug-related issues and grace the Commission on Human Rights' 30th anniversary celebration.¬†

abs-cbn.title: Astronomers bid farewell to $3.9-B Saturn spacecraft
content: Earth received @CassiniSaturn‚Äôs final signal at 7:55am ET. Cassini is now part of the planet it studied. Thanks for the science #GrandFinale pic.twitter.com/YfSTeeqbz1

Astronomers around the world bid farewell Friday to NASA's famed Cassini spacecraft, which launched 20 years ago to circle Saturn and transformed the way we think about life elsewhere in the solar system.
Cassini, an international project that cost $3.9 billion and included scientists from 27 nations, has run out of rocket fuel as expected after a journey of 7.9 billion kilometers.

Its death plunge into the ringed gas giant -- the furthest planet visible from Earth with the naked eye -- is scheduled for shortly after the spacecraft's final contact with Earth at 7:55 am (1155 GMT).
Every time we see Saturn in the night sky, we'll remember. We'll smile. And we'll want to go back. #GrandFinale #GoodbyeCassini #Cassini pic.twitter.com/6tzJ4N9Jif

Cassini's well-planned demise is a way of preventing any damage to Saturn's ocean-bearing moons Titan and Enceladus, which scientists want to keep pristine for future exploration because they may contain some form of life.
Just before 0500 GMT NASA wrote on Twitter that Cassini was reconfiguring "to transmit its final observations to Earth in real time."
According to NASA estimates, Cassini has already crossed the orbital distance of the F ring -- outermost of Saturn's main rings -- for the last time.¬†
Because of the distance, NASA mission control receives data from Cassini with a one hour, 23 minute delay.
The craft's final plunge into Saturn's atmosphere is set to begin just after 1030 GMT.

"It will be sad to see Cassini go on Friday, especially as the instrument we built is still working perfectly," said Stanley Cowley, professor of solar planetary physics at the University of Leicester.
"But we recognize that it is important to bring the mission to an end in a tidy and controlled manner."
Three other spacecraft have flown by Saturn -- Pioneer 11 in 1979, followed by Voyager 1 and 2 in the 1980s.

But none have studied Saturn in such detail as Cassini, named after the French-Italian astronomer Giovanni Domenico Cassini, who discovered in the 17th century that Saturn had several moons and a gap in between its rings.

Cassini showed us the beauty of Saturn.
It revealed the best in us.
Now it's up to us to keep exploring. pic.twitter.com/E4p1jOvFKf
DISCOVERIES
Cassini launched from Cape Canaveral, Florida in 1997, then spent seven years in transit followed by 13 years orbiting Saturn.
In that time, it discovered six more moons around Saturn, three-dimensional structures towering above Saturn's rings, and a giant storm that raged across the planet for nearly a year.

The 22-by-13 foot spacecraft is also credited with discovering icy geysers erupting from Saturn's moon Enceladus, and eerie hydrocarbon lakes made of ethane and methane on Saturn's largest moon, Titan.
In 2005, the Cassini orbiter released a lander called Huygens on Titan, marking the first and only such landing in the outer solar system, on a celestial body beyond the asteroid belt.
Huygens was a joint project of the European Space Agency, Italian Space Agency and NASA.¬†

"The mission has changed the way we think of where life may have developed beyond our Earth," said Andrew Coates, head of the Planetary Science Group at Mullard Space Science Laboratory at University College London.
"As well as Mars, outer planet moons like Enceladus, Europa and even Titan are now top contenders for life elsewhere," he added.
"We've completely rewritten the textbooks about Saturn."
Some 4,000 scientific papers have been based on data from the mission, said Mathew Owens, professor of space physics at the University of Reading.
And its final plunge will reveal even more about the make-up of Saturn's atmosphere before Cassini disintegrates like a meteor.
"No doubt scientists will be analyzing the information from its final, one-way trip into Saturn's atmosphere for years to come," Owens said.

abs-cbn.title: Bagong testigo, lumutang kaugnay sa pagpatay kina Carl Angelo at 'Kulot'
content: Lumutang nitong Biyernes ang isang bagong testigo na nakita umanong magkakasama sina Carl Angelo Arnaiz, Reynaldo de Guzman alyas "Kulot", ang drayber ng taxi na si Tomas Bagcal at ang mga pulis-Caloocan.

Gamit na rin ang kuha ng CCTV sa kanto ng Dagat-Dagatan Extension at C3 Road sa Barangay 28, Caloocan City, sinabi ng testigo na bandang 3:40 ng madaling araw noong Agosto 18 ay may dumating na tatlong lalaking naka-motorsiklo at kasunod ang isang "R & E" taxi na pinaniniwalaang minaneho ni Bagcal, ang drayber na umano'y hinoldap ni Arnaiz.¬†
Ayon sa testigo, sakay ni Bagcal sa harapan si Police Officer 1 Jefrey Perez, at sa likod naman ng taxi ay magkatabi ang 14-anyos na si De Guzman, 19-anyos na si Arnaiz at isa pang lalaki.

Sa kuwento ng testigo, ang lalaking nakita sa CCTV na bumaba ng taxi at may kausap sa telepono ay ang pulis na si Perez. Maya-maya pa ay bumalik ito sa taxi at tila kinausap si Bagcal, at muling sumakay sa loob.
Bago mag alas-4 ng madaling araw, nagsimulang magkatrapik sa kalsada at nagsimula nang "magbarikada" ang mga pulis sa C3 papuntang 5th Avenue, ayon sa testigo.
Ilang minuto pa, umalis ang taxi papuntang C3 at nakasakay pa rin umano sina De Guzman, Arnaiz, Perez, at ang isang lalaking taga barangay, dagdag niya.
Ilang saglit ay nakarinig na raw ang testigo ng dalawang putok ng baril.
Nang sundan niya ang pinanggalingan ng putok, nakita niyang may nakabulagta sa damuhan at nandoon din daw si Bagcal, Perez, iba pang mga pulis na nakasibilyan at mga barangay tanod.
Nang siya ay nakiusyoso, pinaghahanap pa raw ng mga pulis at barangay ang isa pang holdaper na nakatakas, kuwento ng testigo.
Dagdag niya, noong Setyembre 1 o 2 ay nakita niyang kasama ni Perez si "Kulot" sa loob ng police mobile sa C3 Road.
Nagkakaiba naman ang sinabi ng testigo sa sinabi ni Bagcal.

Ayon sa pahayag ni Bagcal, pinasunod siya ng mga pulis sa C3 Road matapos niyang ihatid si Arnaiz sa istasyon ng pulis sa Caloocan at iginiit niyang "scripted" ang pagkakapatay ng mga pulis kay Arnaiz.
Tumanggi munang humarap sa camera ang testigo, pero ayon sa kanya, handa siyang magsalita at tumulong sa imbestigasyon basta't mabibigyan siya ng seguridad.¬†
-- Ulat ni Niko Baua, ABS-CBN News

abs-cbn.title: The Day in Photos: 15 September 2017
'Tadhana'? Sara Duterte jokes about being in same building as Trillanes
content: MANILA- Davao City Mayor Sara Duterte on Friday made light of learning that she was in the same hotel as Sen. Antonio Trillanes IV, a staunch critic of her family.
In a Facebook post, the President's daughter showed a Viber conversation with a friend who had told her of Trillanes' presence in the same building.
"Perfect timing. Ako na bibira. Pahiram ng martilyo," Duterte jokingly responded. She also captioned the photo "That Thing Called Tadhana," in reference to the 2014 Filipino film.

Since the campaign period last year, Trillanes has been vocal in criticizing the Mayor's father, President Rodrigo Duterte, and more recently her husband Manases Carpio, and her brother, Davao City Vice Mayor Paolo Duterte.
Trillanes claims that Paolo Duterte and Carpio have more than P100 million in bank deposits and have linked the two to corruption at the Bureau of Customs. They both denied the charges.
The senator also claimed that Paolo Duterte had a back tattoo that would prove the latter's alleged membership in a drug triad, of which the Davao City mayor also poked fun.
The President earlier defended his son and son-in-law against Trillanes' charges, calling his evidence against them "trash."¬†

abs-cbn.title: Payday Friday traffic
45 pass electrical-engineer upgrade exam
content: The Professional Regulation Commission announced Friday that 45 candidates passed the Technical Evaluation for the Upgrading as Professional Electrical Engineers, which was conducted by the Board of Electrical Engineering in Manila this month.
See the full list of passers here.

abs-cbn.title: Pasahe sa taxi, planong taasan upang makasabay sa serbisyo ng Grab, Uber
content: MANILA - Plano ng Land Transportation Franchising and Regulatory Board (LTFRB) na taasan ang pasahe sa taxi upang makasabay sa serbisyo ng mga ride-hailing services gaya ng Grab at Uber.¬†
Para sa LTFRB, panahon na para itaas ang pasahe sa taxi ayon sa formula ng Grab at Uber, na base rin sa distansya.¬†

Halos maipapantay na rin anila sa pasahe sa Grab at Uber ang taxi rates, ngunit wala pa rin silang 'surge rates' o pansamantalang pagtaas sa pasahe ayon sa taas ng demand sa mga ride-sharing services.¬†
Ilalabas ang desisyon hinggil dito bago matapos ang buwan.¬†

Ayon naman sa ahensiya, dapat tumbasan ng taxi companies ng kalidad na serbisyo ang taas-pasahe. Matatandaang talamak ang reklamo ng mga pasahero sa mga taxi dahil sa mga driver na tumatanggi o pumipili ng destinasyon, o kaya'y nangongontrata.¬†
¬†
Ikinababahala naman ng grupo ng mga taxi driver na baka hindi sila piliin ng mga pasahero sakaling sumobra ang pagtaas ng pasahe.
Para naman sa ilang mga pasahero, sa ride-hailing services pa rin sila sasakay kung magkakapareho na ng pasahe.¬†
Hamon ito ngayon sa mga taxi operator na humiling ng taas-pasahe sa pangakong kaya naman nila ayusin ang mga unit.

Dagdag pa nila, para sa mga taxi driver naman ang dagdag-pasahe kung sakali dahil ayon sa Philippine National Taxi Operators Association (PNTOA), hindi rin sila agad manghihingi ng pagtaas ng boundary.¬†
¬†¬† ¬†
Ayon pa kay Bong Suntay, pangulo ng PNTOA, nagsilipatan na nga ang mga taxi driver sa ride-hailing services dahil sa pagliit ng kita mula nang magkaroon ng Grab at Uber.¬†
Para naman sa LTFRB, mas marami nang mapagpipilian ang mga pasahero kung halos pantay na ang pasahe at serbisyo ng mga taxi at ride-hailing services.¬†
-- Ulat ni Jacque Manabat, ABS-CBN News

abs-cbn.title: Caraga State U grad tops forester licensure exam
content: The Professional Regulation Commission announced Friday that 721 out of 1,482 examinees passed the Forester Licensure Examination given this month.
Victor Lobrigas Corbita, of Caraga¬†State University in Butuan, topped the exam with a rating of 91.20%.
Jaena Naejan Evangelista Tiongco (University of the Philippines‚ÄîLos Ba√±os) came in second with 90.90%, while Ailyn Mesias dela Pe√±a (Caraga¬†State University‚ÄîButuan) placed third with 90.85%.
UP Los Ba√±os was this year‚Äôs top performing school with a 99.27% passing rate.
