abs-cbn.title: Massage and haircut behind bars: Baguio city jail opens salon and spa
content: Baguio City Jail opens salon and spa to help female detainees earn a living while detained.
BAGUIO CITY ‚Äì Need a haircut or massage? Here's a unique spa for those seeking a one-of-a-kind ambiance.¬†
The Baguio City Jail has opened a salon and spa, a project aimed at helping inmates at its female dormitory to still provide for their families even while detained.¬†
Its walls painted in inviting pastel pink and purple, the spa started offering services on Monday.¬†
Fifty inmates who received training from the Technical Education and Skills Development Authority (TESDA) work at the salon and spa.
‚Äú'Yung iba, they came with the skill already. Ang ginawa namin is to enhance those skills, para habang nandito sila ay makatulong sila sa kanilang family," one of the inmates said.
Within a week, the inmates already had 160 customers and collected over P13,809.
Some of the clients said they were satisfied given the relatively cheaper prices at the jail salon and spa.
‚ÄúMaganda 'yung services nila kasi taken care of ka. Sa iba kasi medyo mataas ang singil, dito mababa lang,‚Äù customer Elisa Chan said.
A chunk of the income goes to inmates who render services while a portion is allotted for a group fund.
Alias 'Josie', an inmate since 2016, is happy to still be able to provide even a small amount of money for her son.
‚ÄúNow na ganitong may livelihood, nakakapag-provide pa rin kami sa family outside, so hindi namin nafi-feel na wala kaming silbi sa pamilya namin, na pabigat lang kami,‚Äù she said.
Jail Insp. April Rose Ayangwa said activities like these do not only benefit the inmates, but also the jail guards.
‚ÄúNapakalaking tulong ito as to their behavior. Kapag busy sila, hindi sila palaaway. Sa management, magaan 'yung pag-manage,‚Äù she said.
The jailhouse salon and spa offers the following services:

Hair rebond: P400-P600
Hair dye: P150-P25¬†
Hot oil: P150-P250
Cellophane: P200-P300
Facial: P200
Body scrub: P250
Body massage: P250
Foot spa: P200
Hand spa: P100
Blow dry: P30
Hair press: P50
Hair trim: P80
Eyebrow threading: P30
Manicure: P50
Pedicure: P50
Those who would like to visit may go straight to the city jail, but the management said it would be better to make reservations through these numbers: (074) 619-2764 and (074) 422-2851.
Aside from the salon and spa, the Baguio City Jail also has a host of other livelihood programs for inmates, among them baking, cross-stitching, and making crochet and handicraft products.¬†
The inmates' work are displayed at the Inmates‚Äô Livelihood Display Center.
The city jail management said it aims to train inmates on different skills to help them start a new life upon their release.

abs-cbn.title: IPs protest 'US intervention' in Marawi
10 nabbed in 'Oplan Pokemon' in Cebu City
content: CEBU CITY - Police arrested 10 individuals for illegal drugs and illegal gambling in Barangay Duljo-Fatima and Barangay Pasil, Cebu City on Friday.
Twenty video karera machines were confiscated and around P200,000 worth of illegal drugs were confiscated during "Oplan Pokemon" or simultaneous police operations against illegal activities.
Sr. Insp. Alejandro Lopez, deputy chief of San Nicolas Police Station, said Vangeline Oyao, 64, is considered one of the big players in the illegal drug trade in the area.

Authorities were also able to arrest Oyao's 22-year-old grandson.
¬†

abs-cbn.title: PH seeks share of global nature tourism market
content: Thirty percent of the about a billion tourists in the world are looking at nature tourism, and the Philippines is looking to encourage them to visit the country.

In the 5 years since farm tourism, which is categorized under nature tourism, was mainstreamed through a vegetable farm in Laguna, the country has seen a law enacted to guide the industry's development, said International School of Sustainable Tourism president, former Tourism Secretary Mina Gabor.

Despite the challenges such as the recent bird flu crisis and the protracted war in Marawi City, Gabor is optimistic that farm tourism will continue to grow, especially with the help of the younger generation.

"What is exciting now is that many millennials are actually getting themselves involved and they‚Äôre bringing in technology and additional ways of farming. That is one of the things we‚Äôre going to show, the millennials that are now doing farm tourism," she told ANC's Market Edge.

abs-cbn.title: Mga pulis sa Caloocan, inalis sa puwesto
Jinggoy Estrada allowed to post bail over 'pork barrel' case - sources
content: MANILA (3RD UPDATE) - Former senator Jinggoy Estrada, who is detained on plunder charges over alleged involvement in the multibillion-peso "pork barrel" scam, was allowed to post bail Friday, sources said.
The Sandiganbayan 5th Division released a 15-page resolution granting Estrada's motion for bail.
TINGNAN: Resolusyon ng Sandiganbayan na pumabor sa bail petition ni Jinggoy Estrada. | via @joycebalancio pic.twitter.com/p1likLOTgV
The court set Estrada's bail at P1 million for plunder and P330,000 in total for 11 counts of graft, at P30,000 each.
The bail was similar to the amount posted by former senator Juan Ponce Enrile who was also granted liberty but by the Supreme Court.

Estrada's omnibus motion cited the case of former President Gloria Macapagal-Arroyo, and the lack of a "main plunderer" in his case which also involves businesswoman Janet Lim Napoles, Pauline Labayen and John Raymond De Asis.
The Sandiganbayan, however, denied Estrada's motion to dismiss.¬†

"This ruling does not delve on the guilt or innocence of accused Estrada. It also (does) not preclude the prosecution from its right (to) present further evidence during the trial of the case, and the prosecution's opportunity to prove the guilt of the accused for the crime charged," the court said.
The court also noted that Estrada is not a flight risk.

"The fact that he surrendered himself voluntarily to the authorities and remained in detention for almost three years now also negate the intention or inclination to evade the legal processes," it said.
The special 5-member division had a vote of 3-2 in favor of Estrada.¬†

The senator, son of former President Joseph Estrada, was accused of pocketing P183 million in kickbacks from fake projects, allegedly with help from businesswoman Janet Lim Napoles, the alleged scam mastermind.
The senator has been detained at the Philippine National Police headquarters in Camp Crame since 2014.
On Friday, Estrada's wife Precy Ejercito and his children visited him in his detention cell.
Precy Ejercito, dumating sa Custodial Center para dalawin ang mister na si dating Sen Jinggoy Estrada | via @dzmmPatrol44 pic.twitter.com/NeKONJAYVP
"Noong una'y hindi kami makapaniwala, pero salamat sa Panginoon at dumating ang araw na ito. Siya lang ang kinapitan namin. Nagpapasalamat kami sa Sandiganbayan," said Ejercito.¬†
"Tomorrow is the big day!," she said.¬†
She said they would go to the Sandiganbayan at 9 a.m. on Saturday to post bail.
Offices at the Sandiganbayan normally have a skeletal workforce on Saturdays and is open starting 8 a.m.
Upon release, Estrada will first go to their Quezon City home, she said. The family then plans to go to his father Manila Mayor Joseph Estrada's house to have lunch.¬†
They will then have a thanksgiving mass Saturday afternoon at the Pinaglabanan Church in San Juan, the family's bailiwick, she said.¬†
Atty. Alexis Suarez, Estrada's counsel, said the Sandiganbayan's resolution to allow the former senator to post bail is proof that the charges filed against him have no grounds.
"Higit sa kung ano pa man, ang desisyon ng Sandiganbayan ay matibay na patunay na mahina ang kaso laban sa kanya tulad ng sinabi nya noong una pa," Suarez said in a statement.
Estrada is among three former senators tagged in the scam, along with Senators Bong Revilla and Juan Ponce Enrile.
Enrile was released on bail in 2015, while Revilla remains detained while on trial.¬†

abs-cbn.title: Lorenzana: N. Korea‚Äôs latest missile launch a ‚Äòdangerous act‚Äô
content: MANILA ‚Äì Defense Secretary Delfin Lorenzana on Friday slammed North Korea‚Äôs launch of a missile which flew over Japan, calling it a ‚Äúvery dangerous act.‚Äù

‚ÄúThat is a very dangerous act by the North Koreans. First, they keep flying those‚Ä¶ sending those missiles up without any reason but maybe except to scare us here, the neighboring countries,‚Äù Lorenzana said in a news conference in Malaca√±ang.
Lorenzana said North Korea‚Äôs activities have triggered alarm in the Philippines, an ally of the United States, North Korea‚Äôs chief nemesis.
He also warned that North Korean missiles could hit the Philippines since Pyongyang‚Äôs ‚Äútechnology [is] not accurate.‚Äù

‚ÄúThey might be aiming for some other, but it will drop into another country like the Philippines. Even the President (Rodrigo Duterte) is very much concerned about these missiles from North Korea,‚Äù he said.
This would be disastrous, he said, as Manila does not have the capability to shield itself from a nuclear attack.
The most likely scenario is for debris to hit the Philippines if North Korea launches a missile towards the Pacific, military and disaster management officials have said.

North Korea fired a missile that flew over Japan‚Äôs northern Hokkaido far out into the Pacific Ocean on Friday, South Korean and Japanese officials said, deepening tensions after Pyongyang‚Äôs recent test of its most powerful nuclear bomb.
The missile flew over Japan and landed in the Pacific about 2,000 kms east of Hokkaido, Japanese Chief Cabinet Secretary Yoshihide Suga told reporters.

North Korea has launched dozens of missiles under young leader Kim Jong Un as it accelerates a weapons program capable of targetting the United States with a powerful, nuclear-tipped missile. Two tests in July were for long-range intercontinental ballistic missiles capable of reaching at least parts of the US mainland. -- with Reuters

abs-cbn.title: Militants burn Duterte-Trump effigy
Faeldon to file ethics complaint vs Lacson, Trillanes
content: Ex-Customs Commissioner Nicanor Faeldon to file ethics complaint vs Sen @iampinglacson on Monday-Sept 18, lawyer says @ABSCBNNews @ANCALERTS
MANILA - Detained former Customs Commissioner Nicanor Faeldon plans to personally file his complaint against Sen. Panfilo Lacson before the Senate Ethics Committee.
On Friday, lawyer Jose Di√±o, counsel and spokesperson of Faeldon, said his client intends to file the complaint at 11 a.m. on Monday.

‚ÄúCaptain Faeldon will request for permission from (Office of the Sergeant-at-Arms) OSAA to be allowed to personally file, under guard of course, his verified ethics complaint,‚Äù Di√±o told reporters in a text message.
Faeldon's complaint against Lacson is based on grounds of calumny, abuse of right and privilege, and serious misconduct.
It stems from the senator‚Äôs ‚ÄúKita Kita‚Äù privilege speech linking Customs officials ‚Äì led by Faeldon ‚Äì to corruption within the bureau under the ‚Äútara system.‚Äù
The senator alleged that Faeldon received P100 million as a welcome gift from Customs brokers.

Faeldon strongly denied the allegation, which resulted in his refusal to attend a Senate Blue Ribbon Committee hearing on the P6.4 billion shabu shipment from China, which ended with his personal decision to be detained at the Senate.
Lacson welcomed the filing of the complaint and said it is the "right of anybody."
"In fact, that was the advice to him by Sen. (Richard) Gordon when he visited him in his detention place," he said.
The senator, however, cited Article 6, Section 11 of the Constitution, which states that a member of Congress cannot be arrested if the chamber is in session.
Lacson emphasized that no lawmaker can be questioned nor held liable for any speech or debate in Congress.
"Therefore, it is his right to waste bond paper and ink. Anyway, he has the money to pay his lawyers even if it's tantamount to an exercise in futility and stupidity," he said.
Di√±o denied it was Gordon, chair of the Senate Blue Ribbon Committee, who advised Faeldon to file a complaint.
He said it was Faeldon's family who actually insisted on doing such, following Lacson's speech which allegedly aimed at destroying the former Custom's chief's name and reputation.

After filing the complaint against Lacson, Faeldon's camp will also file a similar ethics complaint against Sen. Antonio Trillanes for supposedly throwing malicious allegations against him during the Senate hearings.
Trillanes said Faeldon "seems to not run out of gimmicks."
"But at the end of the day, he needs to face the committee and answer our questions," he said.

abs-cbn.title: 1 kritikal sa pag-araro ng truck sa mga sasakyan sa Baguio
content: BAGUIO CITY- Kritikal ang kalagayan ng isang babae matapos itong mabangga sa pag-araro ng isang cement mixer truck sa 5 sasakyan at 2 motorsiklo sa Marcos Highway nitong Biyernes ng tanghali.
Agad isinugod ang biktimang hindi pa nakikilala sa Baguio General Hospital matapos itong mabangga ng 2 sasakyan na inararo ng truck.
Kwento ng mga drayber ng mga natamaang sasakyan, matulin ang takbo ng truck.

"Paalis na kami sa kainan tapos may bumangga nalang sa likod namin, ang bilis nung mixer tapos nabangga niya pa 'yung mga nakaparada na sasakyan sa gilid," kwento ni Elmer Tamundong, drayber ng isa sa mga sasakyang nabangga.
Nagtamo rin ng mga galos ang mga drayber ng sasakyan na nabangga.
Ayon naman sa drayber ng truck na nakiusap na huwag pangalanan, napansin na lang niya na wala nang preno ang mixer.
"Nung palusong na, trapik na. Nag-preno ako tapos walang preno, tapos ayun naghanap ako kung saan puwede ibangga, pero wala kasi puro naka-park... Ayun, nabangga ko lahat," aniya.
Galing sa isang batching plant sa Tuba, Benguet ang mixer na dadalhin sana sa Barangay BGH compound sa Baguio.
Nasa kustodiya na ng mga pulis ang drayber ng truck na humihingi ng tawad sa mga naaksidente nito.
Maaari siyang maharap sa kasong reckless imprudence resulting in damage to property.

abs-cbn.title: Caloocan mayor backs city police purge
content: MANILA - Caloocan City Mayor Oscar Malapitan on Friday welcomed the move of the National Capital Region Police Office (NCRPO) to relieve all policemen assigned in his city, saying drastic measures were necessary to cleanse the force.¬†
"Suportado natin ang desisyon ng NCRPO na palitan lahat ang mga pulis ng Caloocan. Kailangan na ng drastikong pagkilos para maalis ang mga bugok na pulis sa lungsod" Malapitan said.

NCRPO chief Oscar Albayalde earlier said a total of 62 Caloocan City police officers have been relieved, while there are plans to reassign and retrain 1,000 more following recent incidents involving the city's police.¬†

The city-wide police cleanse came as Caloocan's police force was in the middle of a controversy following the deaths of Kian Loyd Delos Santos, 17, and Carl Angelo Arnaiz, 19, in the hands of city cops in separate operations in August.¬†

Delos Santos, who police tagged in illegal drugs, was slain in an anti-narcotics sweep in the City on Aug. 16, after allegedly shooting at pursuing officers. Arnaiz was meanwhile killed on Aug. 18 when he allegedly robbed a taxi driver, also in Caloocan.¬†
But families of the two teens are calling for justice, asserting that the boys were not involved in crime. Witness statements and evidence also suggest the two were murdered.¬†
Caloocan officers were also tagged in a robbery on Sept. 7.¬†
Malapitan said that while there may be some negative perception about Caloocan at this time, his city remains peaceful.
"Ang Caloocan ay nananatiling matahimik na lungsod. Ang mga nangyayari, natitiyempuhan lang at hindi naman sa Caloocan nangyayari," Malapitan said.

He added that just last year, the Philippine National Police awarded the Caloocan City Police Station as one of the most outstanding. He said Caloocan was also recognized as one of the most peaceful cities in 2014 and 2015.
"Lahat ng ito'y gumuho dahil sa... sunod-sunod na mga pangyayari. Iniimbestigahan na ang mga ito. Hayaan po natin ang husgado na mag-desisyon," Malapitan said.

Various groups meanwhile staged a black Friday protest in front of the police headquarters in Caloocan City calling for an end to killings, especially of teens who they say have fallen victim to police impunity.¬†
Activists staged a protest infront of Caloocan City Police HQ calling for a stop on the killings under the drug war. pic.twitter.com/7or7kDkWzQ
They called on authorities to be more humane in enforcing the government's drug war, and to be sure of the suspects they arrest and tag as drug personalities.¬†

Senior Supt Jemar Modequillo, the newly appointed Caloocan City police chief, said the PNP leadership has taken steps to get rid of the undesirables in the force, and that appropriate charges have been filed against them.¬†
Still, Modequillo appealed to the public not to quickly judge Caloocan police as scalawags, murderers, robbers or criminals.¬†
While there may be some erring officers in the city, he said there are still many policemen who are doing the right thing, genuinely serving the public, and upholding the rights of citizens.
"Nagkakaroon tayo ng internal cleansing. Magkakaroon ng reshuffling. Baka mayroon nang too much familiarity," Modequillo said.
"Bigyan natin ng kaunting puwang, bigyan natin ng window 'yung mga gumagawa ng tama. Hindi lahat ng pulis loko. Mayroong ilan, hindi natin dine-deny 'yan, kailangan ito pagtulung-tulungan," he added.

abs-cbn.title: Pamilya ng binatilyong natagpuang naaagnas, humiling ng proteksiyon
content: Matapos makatanggap ng balitang may umaaligid sa kanilang tahanan sa Caloocan City, humiling ng proteksiyon para sa kanyang pamilya ang ama ng binatilyong natagpuang naagnas.
Ayon kay Dionisio Remecio, ama ng 16-anyos na si Michael Angelo, may nakita umanong mistulang nagmamanman sa kanilang tahanan, ngunit agad namang lumisan nang usisain sa pakay.

"Hindi ko lang alam kung anong tinitingnan niya. Kung hindi masama ang intensiyon niya, dapat pagtanong sa kanya kung sino hinahanap, dapat hinarap niya yung nagtatanong, hindi yung kusa na lang siya umalis," pahayag ni Dionisio.
Ikinababahala ng pamilya ang insidente at umapela ng proteksiyon sa kinauukulan.
Samantala, nakaburol na sa tahanan ng pamilya Remecio ang mga labi ni Michael Angelo.
Alas-11 Biyernes ng umaga nang madala sa kanilang tahanan ang mga labi ng binatilyo.
Labi ng 16 anyos na si Michael Angelo, na natagpuang nakatali at nakabalot sa sako sa Bulacan, naidala na sa bahay ng pamilya sa NorthCal pic.twitter.com/5qmVnxSwE7
Mananatiling nakasara ang kabaong dahil nasa decomposing stage na ang katawan ng biktima. Nakatakdang ilibing ang binatilyo sa darating na Miyerkoles.
Posibleng ilabas na rin bukas ang resulta ng DNA at autopsy sa bangkay ng bata.
Huling nakitang buhay ng mag-asawa ang kanilang anak noong Agosto 26. Hindi na ito umuwi pa matapos na magdamag mamasada ng tricycle.¬†

Natagpuan na lamang ang naagnas na bangkay ni Michael na nakasilid sa sako at nakatali ang kamay sa isang sapa sa San Jose del Monte, Bulacan nitong Setyembre 12. -- May ulat ni Vivienne Gulla, ABS-CBN News

abs-cbn.title: Want funding? Alvarez says CHR must justify its programs
content: MANILA- If the Commission on Human Rights wants to have its budget restored, House Speaker Pantaleon Alvarez said the agency should justify its programs.
In a press conference on Friday, Alvarez said the CHR should submit a program on how they plan to protect human rights so lawmakers can assess whether the agency deserves a higher budget.
"Yung pagbabalik ng budget ng CHR eh magdedepende yan dun sa ibibigay nila sa amin na programa. Kung makita namin na maganda yung programa eh, bakit hindi?" he said.
Earlier this week the House of Representatives voted to slash the agency's budget to only P1,000 from from the original budget proposal of P623.38 million.
The move drew flak on social media with senators vowing to restore the agency's full budget.
Alvarez said being a constitutional body was not enough reason to given funding, saying the agency should fulfill its mandate as well.
Under the Constitution, the CHR is tasked to probe human rights violations involving civil and political rights.
"Hindi po tama na dahil constitutional body ka, na yung CHR 'no, ay pikit-mata na naming basta silang bibigyan ng budget," he said.
"Kung hindi nila ginagawa yung tungkulin nila, bakit namin sila bibigyan ng budget?" he added.
The budget bill of the CHR still has to go through the Senate and the bicameral conference committee before it is signed by the President.

abs-cbn.title: Tempest Wind: PH, US to hold joint counter-terror drills
content: MANILA‚ÄîThe Philippines and the United States will hold a joint counter-terrorism drill this month to test the ability of both governments to conduct anti-terrorism operations.
The Tempest Wind drill, which will take place in the Philippines and Hawaii, will include planning on counter-terrorism strategy, including senior decision-making and tactical responses.
Tempest Wind was approved late last year by the Mutual Defense Board and Security Engagement Board to test force readiness and exercise interoperability.
Earlier this month, US Ambassador Sung Kim assured the Philippines of Washington's commitment in fighting terrorism.
"Counter-terrorism is a shared priority for both of our countries, and [is] important for regional stability," Kim said.
A long-time ally of the Philippines, the US has provided technical assistance to Philippine troops still battling Islamic State-inspired extremists in Marawi City.
Washington also donated P730 million ($15 million) in humanitarian aid for relief and rehabilitation efforts in the besieged city.

Of this amount, P153 million will be used to deliver basic relief supplies such as drinking water, hygiene kits, and shelter materials for evacuees. The remaining P577 million will be used to help fund rehabilitation efforts in the conflict-stricken city.

abs-cbn.title: Alvarez on CHR's Gascon: Sobrang kapal ng mukha niya
content: MANILA- House Speaker Pantaleon Alvarez on Friday said Commission on Human Rights (CHR) Chairman Chito Gascon should be ashamed for refusing to resign from his post.
"Sobrang kapal ng mukha niya (Gascon)...Kung sinasabi na ng karamihan na hindi niya ginagampanan yung trabaho niya, hindi niya ginagawa, eh dapat mahiya ka na eh," Alvarez said in a press conference.
"Hindi mo na ginagawa yung trabaho mo humihingi ka pa ng sweldo sa gobyerno. Hindi naman siguro tama yun," he added.¬†
Alvarez said Gascon, the Liberal Party's director general from 2008 to 2011, has been showing his biases in his actions as CHR chairperson.
Gascon has been attacked by allies of President Rodrigo Duterte since opposing the administration's brutal war on drugs.¬†
Alvarez mentioned how Gascon was able to visit detained Sen. Leila de Lima, a Liberal Party member, but was not able to visit other prisoners.

"Kung dadalaw ka sa mga nabilanggo doon‚Ä¶anlapit-lapit naman nung selda nung iba eh bakit hindi niya man lang dinalaw at inalam yung kalagayan din nung ibang prisoners? Bakit isang tao lang?" he said.
Gascon earlier rejected calls for him to resign after the House of Representatives voted to slash the CHR's budget to only P1,000 from the original budget proposal of P623.38 million.
He instead maintained that CHR operations will continue since the budget bill still has to go through the Senate and the bicameral conference committee before it is signed by the President.¬†

"The commission will continue to operate so long as the Constitution operates. Despite this defeat in the House, we look forward to defending our budget in the Senate and we hope that reason...will prevail both at the Senate as well as in the bicameral conference committee," he said.

abs-cbn.title: Ilang lugar sa QC, Valenzuela, pansamantalang mawawalan ng tubig
content: Pansamantalang mawawalan ng tubig ang ilang lugar sa Quezon City at Valenzuela sa susunod na linggo, ayon sa Maynilad.
Nakatakdang magsagawa ng pipe network upgrade ang Maynilad simula alas-9 ng gabi ng Setyembre 21, Huwebes hanggang alas-5 ng umaga ng Biyernes.
Apektado ng nasabing proyekto ang mga sumusunod na lugar:
Quezon City

‚Ä¢ Bagbag
‚Ä¢ Greater Fairview
‚Ä¢ Gulod
‚Ä¢ Nagkaisang Nayon
‚Ä¢ San Bartolome
‚Ä¢ Santa Lucia
‚Ä¢ Sauyo
‚Ä¢ Talipapa
Valenzuela
‚Ä¢ Ugong
Inabisuhan naman ng Maynilad ang mga residente ng apektadong lugar na mag-ipon ng sapat na tubig bilang paghahanda sa water interruption.

abs-cbn.title: CHR Negros chief plans to sell fish balls, nuts to augment P1K budget
content: MANILA- The Commission on Human Rights (CHR) in Negros Oriental made light of the recent decision of the lower House to allot only P1,000 to their agency by offering laundry services and street food.
Jess Ca√±ete, head of the agency, took his frustration and disappointment on the slashing of their budget by preparing a menu of services which includes laundry and orasyon bisaya (quackery).
The menu also includes street food for sale such as peanuts, fish balls, and torta.
Ca√±ete even practiced selling with vendors in their building.
"Yes, it is a form of sarcasm for their arrogance," he said.
The House of Representatives earlier this week voted to slash the CHR budget to only P1,000 from the original budget proposal of P623.38 million.¬†
The revised proposals will next go through the Senate and the bicameral conference committee.¬†
Senators have vowed to restore the agency's budget.
For this year alone, the CHR has helped over 100 people in Negros Oriental and has filed 20 cases ranging from violence against women and children to extra-judicial killings.
Ca√±ete expressed hopes that the Senate will be able to restore the full budget for their office.
Gov. Roel Degamo, meanwhile, expressed willingness to help fund the CHR in Negros Oriental from their treasury, saying the agency is vital in the province.
'It is different here in Negros Oriental because CHR talks to the rebels to help the government," he said.

abs-cbn.title: Lorenzana: Nationwide martial law ‚Äòvery remote‚Äô
content: MANILA ‚Äì Defense Secretary Delfin Lorenzana on Friday described as "very remote" the possibility that President Rodrigo Duterte would declare martial law nationwide if the communist threat in the country gets out of hand.

The President had said on Sept. 9 that he might place the entire country under martial law if communist rebels would commit the ‚Äúmistake‚Äù of staging a rebellion ‚Äúwhere there‚Äôs fighting in the streets.

This would expand the standing martial rule in Mindanao, which Duterte had declared on May 23, amid clashes between state forces and terrorists in Mindanao, and later extended by Congress to December on his request.¬†
Lorenzana, however, said this scenario is unlikely as communist forces in the country have significantly weakened.
‚ÄúSa aking pananaw naman, estimate ko, very remote naman mangyari,‚Äù he said in a press briefing in Malaca√±ang.

‚ÄúPero si Presidente lang kasi is very concerned that it might get out of hand. So sabi niya, ‚ÄòI might declare martial law.‚Äô But I don‚Äôt think the possibility that the Left will be able to conduct a massive demonstration across the country, disrupting the civil government or the lives of the people, eh hindi naman siguro mangyayari ‚Äòyun," he said.¬†
Asked in a separate briefing, House Speaker Pantaleon Alvarez, among the President's closest allies, said he and the President have had no discussions on martial rule.¬†
"‚ÄúWala, wala. Nabanggit lang siguro ni President 'yun. Alam mo naman si President maraming sinasabi,‚Äù he told reporters.¬†
Militant groups are expected to mount protests on Sept. 21, the 45th anniversary of the late strongman Ferdinand Marcos' declaration of martial law.¬†
The President said he might suspend work in government offices and classes on the day to ensure public safety.¬†
"This early, I am announcing that I am ordering a holiday para walang masaktan, walang ano kung may demonstration diyan, magkagulo,‚Äù he said Thursday.¬†
The President has been at loggerheads with left-leaning groups since the breakdown of peace talks between the government and the National Democratic Front of the Philippines (NDFP).
Duterte cancelled peace talks with the Left in July following a string of rebel attacks on government forces, including an ambush on his security men in Arakan, North Cotabato in July.
On Thursday, Presidential Adviser on the Peace Process Jesus Dureza said there has been no formal termination of talks yet.¬†

Leftist lawmakers in the House of Representatives on Thursday split from the super majority citing several grounds, among them Duterte's supposed favor for the Marcos family, alleged turnaround from " his promise to separate from the US," violence under the war on drugs, and moves to revive the death penalty.¬†

Duterte's left-leaning appointees to the cabinet- peasant leader Rafael Mariano for agrarian reform, and activist Judy Taguiwalo for social welfare- were meanwhile rejected by the Commission on Appointments.¬†
¬†

abs-cbn.title: Weekday sale, iiwasan muna ng mga mall sa holiday season
content: Napagkasunduan ng Metropolitan Manila Development Authority (MMDA) at mga mall operator na huwag munang magkasa ng sale kapag weekday upang hindi makadagdag sa bigat ng trapiko ngayong holiday season.
Sa isinagawang diyalogo ngayong Biyernes, nakiusap ang ahensiya sa operators na kung maaari ay wala na munang weekday sale. Sa halip, gawin na lamang ito ng Sabado o Linggo.
Katwiran ng MMDA, humahaba ang pila ng sasakyan sa parking ng mga mall at nagkakaroon ng "deadlock" sa seguridad. Diin ng ahensiya, hindi dapat makompromiso ang seguridad ng mga mall.
Nakiusap din ang ahensiya na gawing alas-11 ng umaga hanggang alas-11 ng gabi ang mall hours upang hindi sumabay sa rush hour.
Dagdag pa nila, hangga't maaari ay dapat alas-11 ng gabi hanggang alas-5 ng madaling araw lamang ang pagde-deliver ng mga produkto.
Dapat di umanong sumailalim sa pagsasanay ang mga security guard ng mall sa trafffic management.
Bagama't pakisuyo lamang at hindi isang pormal na utos ang mga napag-usapan, nagpahayag naman ng pagsuporta ang mga mall owner sa mga suhestiyon ng ahensiya.
Target na maipatupad ang mga ito sa Nobyembre.
Ipinarerebyu na rin ng ang sistemang ginawa ng mga shopping center nang nagdaang Pasko para makabawas sa traffic congestion sa Maynila.
Nanawagan din ang MMDA sa publiko na huwag sumabay sa weekend rush kapag mamimili at planuhin ang mga lakad nang mas maaga.

-- Ulat ni Zhander Cayabyab, ABS-CBN News
¬†

abs-cbn.title: Wrapped in embrace: Town councilor, 2 others found dead in Negros Occ
content: MURCIA, Negros Occidental - A town councilor and two others are believed to have been killed by armed men after their bodies were found in Sitio Lilo, Barangay Lopez Jaena in this town on Friday morning.
The body of the woman identified as Leah Mae Canoy was seen embracing the body of Eden Bacordo, a Sangguniang Bayan member of Salvador Benedicto town, when authorities arrived at the crime scene.¬†
Another body was found a few meters away from Canoy and Bacordo's cadavers, and is believed to be that of Bacordo's bodyguard.¬†
Sr. Insp. Ronald Santillan, chief of Murcia police said witnesses claimed the 3 had breakfast at the home of Canoy's aunt near the crime scene.
Bacordo was about to leave the place when armed men fired shots at him. He ran back to the area where they had breakfast and found that were also gunmen waiting for him there.
A witness who refused to be identified said she saw 4 gunmen wearing bonnets and carrying long firearms. They fired at the victims and immediately left the place.¬†
Empty shells of M-16 riffle were found at the crime scene.¬†
Willy Bacordo, the victim's cousin, claimed the councilor attended a court hearing on Thursday and failed to return home.
He added that his cousin told him he has been receiving death threats in relation to the case he was facing but the latter refused to give details.¬†
Investigators are still determining the motive of the slays and the identity of the suspects.¬†

abs-cbn.title: Church bells ring for victims of extra-judicial killings
Sandiganbayan chief won't inhibit from Enrile PDAF cases
content: MANILA- The Sandiganbayan 3rd Division has denied the requests of former Sen. Juan Ponce Enrile and his former chief of staff Gigi Reyes for the inhibition of Sandiganbayan Presiding Justice and 3rd Division Chair Amparo Cabotaje-Tang from handling their plunder cases.

In a decision written by Tang herself, with the concurrence of Associate Justices Sarah Jane Fernandez and Bernelito Fernandez, the court said that the reasons cited by Enrile and Reyes were not valid.¬†

The two, who are accused of plunder along with businesswoman Janet Lim Napoles for the multi-million peso Priority Development Assistance Fund scam, anchored their motion on the alleged bias of Tang because of her appointment to the anti-graft court by former president Benigno "Noynoy" Aquino III.¬†

‚ÄúIndeed, if all members of the bench were to be compelled to recuse themselves on the ground that unconscious powers residing beneath them could probably hold sway, then nobody would be¬∑sitting on any bench in any court right at this very moment,‚Äù the court said.
Enrile and Reyes also questioned the resolutions which the court issued regarding their case.
Tang however said the questioned resolutions, such as the denial of Enrile‚Äôs motion for bill of particulars, were arrived at by all three justices of the 3rd Division.¬†
Tang also refused to accept the allegations of Enrile and Reyes that she should inhibit because the decisions of the court were erroneous.

‚ÄúThe argument that the Court‚Äôs Resolutions are erroneous does not constitute a just and valid ground for the inhibition of the Chairperson. To be sure, an erroneous ruling can be remedied and corrected,‚Äù the court said.
Tang also noted that her, being an appointee, cannot be taken against her.
‚ÄúThe mere fact that the Presiding Justice was appointed by former President Aquino III cannot be considered a valid and just ground for her recusation,‚Äù the court said.¬†
If she will be accused of bias, Tang said she would have sided with Enrile, her ‚Äúkababayan,‚Äù and Enrile‚Äôs lawyer Estelito Mendoza who mentored her at the Office of the Solicitor General.
‚ÄúBut the Chairperson took an oath before she donned her judicial robe - an oath she must discharge without fear or fervor, an oath she will not shrink from,‚Äù the court said.

abs-cbn.title: Cops linked to Kian slay to face summary dismissal hearing on Sept. 19
content: MANILA- The Internal Affairs Service of the Philippine National Police (PNP-IAS) has set the summary dismissal hearing of 16 policemen linked to the killing Kian Loyd Delos Santos on Tuesday, Sept 19.
PNP-IAS Insp. Gen. Alfegar Triambulo said the police respondents are allowed to submit position papers.¬†
"We resolve the case based on the evidence on the record and position paper the respondents and the prosecutors of IAS," he said.
PNP-IAS says cop respondents are allowed to submit position papers. IAS to resolve admin case in 15 days. @ABSCBNNews pic.twitter.com/QDRnTLRpcF
Delos Santos, whose death sparked public outrage and raised questions on the conduct of police operations, was killed in a controversial anti-drug operation last Aug. 16.¬†
Policemen alleged that the teen was a drug runner for his father and uncle, an accusation that his family has strongly denied.
The incident has drawn public condemnation as evidence, including security footage and witness statements, suggest that the teen was executed.¬†
Three cops from the Caloocan City police have been identified in the slay. They are PO3 Arnel Oares and PO1 Jeremias Pereda and Jerwin Cruz.
According to Triambulo, the IAS is still awaiting presidential clearance in order to subject former Caloocan Chief of Police Sr. Supt. Chito Bersaluna to a summary dismissal hearing.¬†
PNP-IAS will resolve the administrative cases based on the evidence on record and position papers submitted by respondents and IAS prosecutors.¬†
PNP-IAS prosecutors will decide on the administrative case after 15 days and will submit their recommendations to PNP Chief, Director General Ronald Dela Rosa.¬†

abs-cbn.title: 62 Caloocan cops sacked after robbery, teens' deaths
content: MANILA - Sixty-two Caloocan City cops were sacked following the killings of at least 2 minors in anti-drug operations and a robbery incident during a police operation last September 7, Metro Manila's police chief said Friday.

National Capital Region Police Office chief Oscar Albayalde said the September 7 operation was inexcusable as the cops did not have a search warrant. Fifteen cops directly involved in the breaking and entering incident have been placed under restrictive custody and will face criminal and administrative charges.¬†
Albayalde confronts Caloocan cops caught on CCTV breaking, entering into a private residence on Sept. 7 |@raffsantos pic.twitter.com/dibNINxpeY

CCTV footage earlier showed armed men entering a house in Caloocan City last September 7 and stealing valuables and cash totaling P30,000. A homeowner said the police broke into her home after a drug suspect claimed he got drugs from the house.¬†

In an interview, Albayalde said he is mulling the reassignment and retraining of all 1,000 Caloocan City police personnel in the coming days. He said the reshuffle was planned even before the killing of Kian Loyd delos Santos and Carl Arnaiz in anti-drug sweeps last month.¬†

"Right now, I think it is immediate that we have to reshuffle all the personnel from substations 2, 4, and 7. We‚Äôre looking for the reshuffling of all the personnel from the Caloocan City Police Office in batches," Albayalde told ANC.
The cops, he said, will be retrained and will be reassigned to other stations in Metro Manila, but will not be allowed to return to their position or assignment in Caloocan.
Albayalde said the vacated posts may be filled by personnel from the Regional Public Safety Battalion.

"What we try to show here is we do not condone any wrongdoing of any of our personnel and even the Chief PNP has made it clear that he will not tolerate any abuses of our personnel from the Philippine National Police," he said.

abs-cbn.title: CHR alarmed over spate of teen deaths
content: The Commission on Human Rights (CHR) has expressed concern over the increasing number of deaths of teens in the country.
In a statement Friday, CHR said the rising figures of teen deaths meant the cases were no longer "isolated" and deserved concrete actions from government.

"Whatever the reason may be, one death is still too many. The recent killing of Kian delos Santos, 17; Carl Angelo Arnaiz, 19; Reynaldo de Guzman, 14; Raymart Siapo, 19; and Grace Omadlao, 16, raises serious concerns on the quality of protection that the government extends to our children," the CHR said.

"The Commission stands that the rights of our children‚Äîeven the accused and adjudged for crimes, but most especially the innocent‚Äîmust be consistently upheld and protected. Rights should never be sacrificed in the drive against criminality and should never be shrugged off when convenient," it added.¬†
Policemen from the Caloocan City Police have been tagged in the separate deaths of Delos Santos, Arnaiz and de Guzman.
Delos Santos, whom police tagged as a drug runner, was dragged from his store in Caloocan and shot dead by cops on August 16.¬†
Arnaiz and de Guzman, both from Cainta in Rizal, were last seen together on August 17. Arnaiz's body was found 10 days after the teen went missing.
Police said Arnaiz tried to rob a taxi and was shot when he allegedly resisted arrest.
On September 6, the body believed to be De Guzman's was found in Gapan, Nueva Ecija. The body bore multiple stab wounds and the head wrapped in tape.
Omadlao, meanwhile was a rape-slay victim from Pasig City. The four men tagged in her death last September 4 have been arrested by police days after her body was found.
Back in April, 19-year old Siapo was shot dead after he was abducted by a group of men in Navotas.
Recently, the decomposing body of Michael Angelo Remecio, 16, was found in San Jose del Monte, Bulacan.

The Commission emphasized the responsibility of the State as cited in the Juvenile Justice and Welfare Act of 2006 that it is required to "apply the principles of restorative justice in all its laws, policies and programs applicable to children in conflict with the law.‚Äù¬†
"Death is never an appropriate response," it stated.
The CHR has dispatched its investigation offices from the National Capital Region and Region III to conduct motu propio probes on the killings of teens and minors across the country.

"We look forward to the commitment of cooperation of the Philippine National Police and other related government agencies in seeking out the truth concerning these deaths. We strongly believe that it is only through openness and transparency that we can achieve justice for these killings," it said.
While they support the government's drive against illegal drugs to provide a better future for children, "but for whom are we doing this drive if they are all gone?"

"Our children deserve better treatment. They ought to be given food and nourishment, not bullets in their bodies; they should be resting on clean, safe shelters, not lying cold in the streets; they need care and protection, not a life of violence. It is only through our collective, genuine commitment that we can ensure the welfare our future generation. Together with all those vulnerable and voiceless, it is high-time for us to stand up for their rights," it stated.

The CHR, which has been critical of the administration's war on drugs campaign, has been under the spotlight after the House of Representatives voted to give the agency only P1,000 in funds for 2018.¬†

abs-cbn.title: Sereno unfazed by ouster raps, won't resign
content: MANILA- Chief Justice Maria Lourdes Sereno won't resign from her post despite an ongoing impeachment process, her spokesman said Friday.

Lawyer Carlo Cruz assured that the chief magistrate remains committed to her work in the Supreme Court even after the House of Representatives justice committee found an ouster complaint against Sereno sufficient in form and substance.

"The public may rest assured that the Chief Justice remains committed to her duties at the Supreme Court, and continues to pursue the judicial reform agenda even as the impeachment process unfolds," Cruz said in a statement.
He added that Sereno has already received a copy of the impeachment complaint and will explain in her answer as to "why the complaint must fail."

"Chief Justice Sereno has always been a staunch defender of the Judiciary and our democracy, and has always exercised utmost competence, integrity, probity, and independence in her official conduct and in the performance of her functions," Cruz said.
The House justice committee on Wednesday found the impeachment complaint filed by lawyer Lorenzo Gadon against Sereno to be sufficient in form and substance.

Gadon's complaint alleges that Sereno had committed culpable violation of the Constitution, betrayal of public trust, corruption, and other high crimes for allegedly lying in her statement of assets, liabilities and net worth, falsification of High Court documents, delayed court action, alleged use of judiciary funds for a P5-million vehicle, and luxury travels, among others.¬†
Cruz has belied the charges against Sereno, saying "many of the allegations in the Gadon complaint are unsupported by evidence or rely mainly on hearsay consisting of newspaper clippings."

abs-cbn.title: Duterte may suspend gov‚Äôt work, classes on Sept. 21
content: MANILA ‚Äì President Rodrigo Duterte said he might order the suspension of work in government offices and classes in Metro Manila on September 21, the 45th anniversary of the Marcos-era martial law, as various groups are set to mount protest actions on that day.
"This early, I am announcing that I am ordering a holiday para walang masaktan, walang ano kung may demonstration diyan, magkagulo,‚Äù Duterte said in an interview on PTV-4 aired on September 14.
"Walang trabaho ang gobyerno ‚Äòyang araw na 'yan at ang klase suspended. At lahat ng public places dito na gusto ninyong i-occupy, kunin ninyo."
The President did not mention a specific date, but various groups have already announced plans to hold protests on September 21.
Defense Secretary Delfin Lorenzana also presumed that the date Duterte was referring to was September 21, since ‚Äúthe Left was threatening to have this massive demonstration on the 21st.‚Äù

‚ÄúDuring my interaction with him early this week sinabi niya kapag magkaroon ng massive rally sa Metro Manila, and it will inconvenience the public, hindi ko sila papapasukin,‚Äù Lorenzana told reporters in a news conference in Malaca√±ang.
In the interview, Duterte said while he may allow protesters to go to the streets, they should not vandalize.
‚Äú‚ÄòYung effigy ko sunugin ninyo. Make an effigy, 'yung kamukha ko. Maski isang libo,‚Äù he said.
He also issued a warning against the left-leaning protesters against bringing armed men to the protest actions.

"Huwag kayong magpapasok ng sabihin niyo red army ninyo na may armas. Huwag kayong magkamali na magsira diyan, sira dito because if you do it, the next thing, ang kaharap ninyo would be the military and the police," he said.
The President has been at loggerheads with left-leaning groups since the breakdown of peace talks between the government and National Democratic Front (NDF) peace panels.
He earlier warned that he might declare martial law in the entire Philippines if the communist threat will grow.
Lorenzana, however, said this scenario is unlikely, citing the supposed weakened force of the communist rebels.

abs-cbn.title: Groups mount Black Friday protest vs killings
content: Various groups staged a protest against extrajudicial killings in front of the Caloocan City Police Friday.
Members of Anakpawis, Bayan, Kadamay, Gabriela and other groups urged authorities to stop the killings, especially of minors.
They believe the killings of minors were clearly unjustified, particularly that of Kian delos Santos, Carl Angelo Arnaiz and Reynaldo de Guzman.
They also condemned reports that a number of Caloocan police were involved in a coordinated robbery in one of the houses in the city.
The groups called on police authorities to be more humane amid fears that more innocents will be killed in the government's war on drugs.¬†
They also fear that it is becoming a trend among Caloocan policemen to use violence as a means to achieve their goals.

Newly-appointed Caloocan City Police chief, Senior Superintendent Jemar Mondequillo, said the PNP has done everything to remove from duty the undesirables in their forces and have filed appropriate cases against them. News Now, 15 September 2017

abs-cbn.title: Taguiwalo, Mariano rejections show Duterte 'bad faith' - Sison
content: MANILA - Communist leader Jose Maria Sison on Friday believes there was bad faith and vindictiveness in President Rodrigo Duterte's appointment of two leftists to his Cabinet, only for them to be rejected by lawmakers.¬†

"It‚Äôs a well-known fact that Duterte has a supermajority, so-called, in Congress and the fact that he did not support his own appointees means he had bad faith in appointing those people," Sison told ANC's Early Edition.

"In the scheme of Duterte, he appointed 2 progressives just to decorate his Cabinet and it‚Äôs a very small number in relation to the majority of rightists and pro-imperialists, representatives of big compradors and landlords, supporters of open-pit mining‚Äîeverything that is against the interest of the Filipino people," he said.
President Duterte earlier offered 4 Cabinet posts to nominees of the Communist Party of the Philippines as the government sought to broker a peace deal with leftist rebels.
Members of the Commission on Appointments, however, rejected the appointments of Social Welfare Secretary Judy Taguiwalo and Agrarian Reform Secretary Rafael Mariano, who were nominated by the CPP.¬†

Sison said the two were nominated to their posts "as individuals who are patriotic, progressive (and) highly qualified" and not as representatives of the CPP, the Communist Party, the New People‚Äôs Army and the National Democratic Front.
"But Duterte abandoned them. I think there was an element of vindictiveness on the part of Duterte and his supermajority in junking these good people," he said.

He said the appointment of former Gabriela party-list lawmaker Luzviminda Ilagan, another progressive, as social welfare undersecretary shows there are no representatives of the CPP to the government.
Sison said he told Duterte, a former student of his, that there will be no representative of the revolutionary force in the Cabinet while peace negotiations are ongoing.

"There has to be a peace agreement, comprehensive between the two sides; then it‚Äôs possible to talk about an alliance or coalition government. But in the meantime, I told him, no representative of the revolutionary forces," he said.
After the Makabayan bloc, a group of progressive lawmakers, left the supermajority in the House of Representatives, Sison also underscored that "has never been any alliance with the Duterte regime."

"There is an armed conflict, a civil war, between the NDF and the revolutionary forces it represents vis-√†-vis the Duterte government and so it cannot be said that there has been an alliance with the Duterte regime," he said.
"All the way Duterte has been lying, breaking the promise he made as early as May 2016. He promised to release all the political prisoners through amnesty. He was lying," he added.

Sison decried that even when a unilateral ceasefire was declared by both sides, "the troops of the Armed Forces of the Philippines were not withdrawn to barracks, but they continued to attack the New People‚Äôs Army and occupy communities."

"The bad faith belonged to the Duterte side, not to the NDF. If there were supposed breaches in the ceasefire arrangement, that could have been discussed, but Duterte would tell of the termination even before talking to his own negotiating panel," he said.

abs-cbn.title: ALAMIN: Road reblocking sa Metro Manila ngayong weekend
content: Pinapayuhan ang mga motorista na umiwas sa ilang kalsada sa Quezon City, Pasig City, at Caloocan City, at dumaan na lamang sa mga alternatibong ruta ngayong weekend.
Sisimulan ng Department of Public Works and Highways (DPWH) ang road reblocking at repair sa ilang kalye alas-11 ng gabi ngayong Biyernes, sa mga sumusunod na lugar:¬†
NORTHBOUND:

- Mac Arthur Highway malapit sa Monumento Circle, Caloocan City¬†
- C.P Garcia Avenue mula University Ave. hanggang E. Jacinto St., QC (2nd lane)
- V. Luna Road mula East Avenue hanggang Kalayaan Ave., Quezon City
- Manila East Road sa tapat ng SM East Ortigas, Pasig City
- Quirino Highway corner La Mesa Dam Road, Quezon City (3rd lane)
¬†
SOUTHBOUND:
¬†
- Bonifacio Avenue sa pagitan ng Mauban St. at Sgt. Rivera, Quezon City (outer lane)
- C-5 Road malapit sa Lanuza Avenue, Pasig City¬†
- Mindanao Avenue paglagpas ng Tandang Sora sa tapat Shell, Quezon City (2nd lane)
- EDSA corner Roosevelt, Quezon City (2nd lane)
- E. Rodriguez Jr. Avenue bago at paglagpas ng Greenmeadows Ave., Quezon City (1st lane from center island)
- E. Rodriguez Jr. Avenue paglagpas ng Boni Serrano Flyover, Quezon City (truck lane)
Muling madaraanan ang mga apektadong kalsada sa Lunes, Setyembre 18, alas-5 ng umaga.

abs-cbn.title: Pulis at mga katutubo, nagkagirian malapit sa US Embassy
content: Mga militanteng katutubo, nakagirian ng mga pulis sa TM Kalaw Ave., Maynila; mga militante nais makalapit sa US Embassy | via @Dennis_Datu pic.twitter.com/yrEzuheN5N
Nagkagirian ang mga pulis at grupo ng militanteng katutubong nagtangkang makalapit sa US Embassy, Biyernes.
Nagkasagupa ang dalawang panig nang magbarikada ang mga pulis upang pigilan ang paglapit ng mga ralyista sa embahada.
Pilit namang lumulusot ang mga militante at nauwi sa tulakan at batuhan ang pagtatagpo.
Dalawang sasakyan ang dagdag na ipinangharang ng mga pulis. Nakaantabay din ang isang fire truck ng Manila Fire Department.
Sinubukan namang awatin ng mga lider ng militanteng grupo ang mga miyembro nito, ngunit nabigo.
Ginugunita ng mga katutubo ang marahas na dispersal ng mga pulis sa mga raliyista sa US Embassy noong nakaraang taon.¬†
Nais din nilang ipahayag ang kanilang pagtutol sa patuloy na panghihimasok ng Amerika sa Pilipinas. Hiling din nila ang pagtigil sa bakbakan sa Marawi na umano'y kagagawin din ng Amerika.
--Ulat ni Dennis Datu, ABS-CBN News

abs-cbn.title: Baguio ordinance seeks to ban tattoos, piercing for minors
content: BAGUIO CITY - It may soon be illegal for any person to tattoo or pierce a minor in Baguio City, if a local ordinance gets the council's nod.

Under the proposal by Councilor Leandro Yangot Jr., establishments such as tattoo parlors would require special permits and licenses to operate, and would be strictly forbidden from servicing clients aged 18 years and below.

The councilor cited common health risks involved in tattooing and piercing, such as "allergic reactions, skin problems, infections, [and] blood borne diseases," as among the primary concerns behind the legislation.¬†

Experts have established that there are numerous ill effects directly related to these practices, such as blood borne diseases including tetanus, Hepatitis B and C; viral infections such as AIDS and cutaneous infections; bacterial infections such as impetigo, toxic shock syndrome which is a bacterial infection that causes skin peeling, tuberculosis and leprosy; and other skin diseases such as psoriasis, photosensitization or high susceptibility of skin to ultraviolet lights, phototoxicity and photogenotoxicity which are chemically induced skin irritations.
The Philippine Tattoo Artist Guild (Phil-TAG) in Baguio fully supports Yangot's proposed ordinance, as they have also advocated the prohibition of tattoos or piercing on minors.

"It has been our advocacy, ever since we started tattoing and piercing, to not allow minors to be tattoed or pierced: first of all, because they are underage, and second, because as parents, we believe that they should be focusing on their schooling," said Butch San Diego, member of the group's board of trustees.
"Even if they reach 18, I think it's best that they seek consent from their legal guardian first," he added.
Under the proposal, violators may face 6 months to a year of imprisonment, a fine of not less than P5,000, and revocation of their business permit.
The proposed ordinance was approved on first reading last Tuesday and shall take effect 15 days after its projected approval in the second reading next month.

abs-cbn.title: 2 lalaki na nagnakaw sa isang simbahan, arestado
content: Arestado ang dalawang hinihinalang miyembro ng akyat bahay gang matapos magnakaw ng perang donasyon sa simbahan sa Quezon City.¬†
Dalawang linggo pa lang matapos makalaya, balik kulungan sina Gerald Riego, alyas Ilad, at Vincent Saquing matapos pagnakawan ang isang simbahan sa Barangay Tandang Sora.

Hindi na nahagip ang pagpasok ng mga suspek pero sa kuha ng CCTV ng barangay, alas-3:12 ng madaling araw noong Setyembre 12, makikita na naglalakad sa gilid ng simbahan sina Riego at Saquing kasama ang dalawang iba pa.
Pero hindi na mga bahay kundi ang Our Lady of Annunciation Parish na pala ang tinarget nila.
Ang laman ng dalawang donation box ng simbahan na aabot sa P60,000 ang natangay ng mga suspek.

Miyembro ng Sputnik at Commando Gang ang mga suspek na umamin rin na madalas nangho-holdup sa labas ng dalawang mall sa North EDSA.
¬†
Hindi pa nare-recover ang perang natangay ng dalawa.
Tumanggi namang magbigay ng pahayag ang pamunuan ng simbahan. ‚Äì Umagang kay Ganda, 15 September 2017

abs-cbn.title: Joma says Duterte building 'fascist dictatorship'
content: MANILA - Communist leader Jose Maria Sison on Friday slammed President Rodrigo Duterte, describing him as the "worst kind of president" who is on his way to declaring a "fascist dictatorship."

Sison, founding chairman of the Communist Party of the Philippines, said Duterte controls all branches of government and has drafted a "killing budget" that allocates only P1,000 for the Commission of Human Rights and millions of pesos to law enforcement in the campaign against illegal drugs.
"I think I have a lot of criticisms to make of previous presidents, but this is the worst kind of president," Sison told ANC's Early Edition.
"I would say that Duterte is very well on the way to proclaiming a fascist dictatorship. He‚Äôs preparing for martial law and to impose a fascist dictatorship in the Philippines," he said.
Duterte's control of the Supreme Court, he said, is manifested by the "quick acquittal of Gloria Macapagal-Arroyo as a way of paying for the support" the former president gave the incumbent.
The leftist leader also slammed the "glorification" of the late dictator, Ferdinand Marcos, whose remains were laid to rest at the Libingan ng mga Bayani with the high court's nod.
"That Supreme Court has already given a blank check for proclaiming martial law nationwide," Sison said.

"But the attack of Duterte on [Chief Justice] Sereno is meant to complete, to tighten complete control over the Supreme Court," he added, referring to the impeachment complain filed against Chief Justice Maria Lourdes Sereno.
GOV'T PREPARING FOR MASSACRES?¬†
Sison also denounced the Lower House's move to allocate only P1,000 to the CHR, which supports his statement that Duterte is heading towards dictatorship.
"The way the budget is made, it‚Äôs a killing budget, a budget for killing people, and a budget for expressing contempt for human rights."

"Reducing budget of the CHR to just P1,000 and then giving ‚Äòtokhang‚Äô this scheme of mass murder, 900 million plus other funds of the Armed Forces of the Philippines and a huge intelligence fund of Duterte‚Äîthis is a budget for fascist dictatorship and for killing more people," he said.
Sison claimed P50,000 is the "going price" for each head of drug users and street-level peddlers, while P100,000 is for each suspected communist rebel.
"They‚Äôre preparing for massacres in the Philippines," he said.
"We are looking forward to despotic regime of widespread death and destruction. That is already well demonstrated in the destruction of Marawi," he added.

Duterte earlier said he has decided to abandon peace negotiations with the National Democratic Front of the Philippines (NDFP), saying the fighting between government and communist rebels could go on for ‚Äúanother 50 years.‚Äù
He also claimed Sison has colon cancer, which the latter denied.¬†

abs-cbn.title: Buong puwersa ng Caloocan PNP, sinibak
content: Iniutos ng National Capital Region Police Office (NCRPO) ngayong Biyernes na tanggalin sa puwesto ang lahat ng pulis sa Caloocan.
Inilabas ni NCRPO chief Oscar Albayalde ang kautusan dahil sa sunod-sunod na kontrobersiyang kinasasangkutan ng Caloocan PNP.
Noong Setyembre 7, nahuli sa CCTV ang panloloob ng mga pulis-Caloocan sa isang bahay.
Kinilala ang isa sa mga nanloob na pulis na si Mark Andrada Dizon na siyang nanguna sa pagpasok sa loob ng bahay.
Sa isa pang camera, kita si Dizon na kasama ang team leader na si Senior Inspector Warren Peralta habang kinakausap ang isang kamag-anak ng may-ari ng bahay, na kinilala lamang bilang alyas "Lorena."
Ayon kay Lorena, bagama't hindi sinaktan, matinding trauma rin ang dinanas ng dalawa niyang apo na nakakita mismo sa paghalughog ng mga armadong pulis.
"Sabi niya lola wag ka na umalis natakot daw sa mga may bitbit ng baril," ani Lorena.
Sinermunan ni Albayalde ang mga pulis na kasama sa operasyon.
"As Criminology graduates, criminology ang alam ko may law kayo di ba? Tama? Sa tingin niyo ba hindi labag sa batas iyon?"
Sinabon din ni Albayalde ang nasibak na station commander na si Chief Inspector Timothy Aniway Jr. dahil walang spot report ang isinagawang operasyon sa bahay ni Lorena.
Ayon kay Aniway: "Hindi po nila ipinaalam na may pinasok silang bahay. Galugad ang ipinaalam, hindi akyat bahay."
Ani Albayalde, una nang sinibak sa puwesto ang mga tauhan ng Caloocan PNP Station 7. Sisibakin na rin sa mga darating na araw ang mga miyembro ng iba pang estasyon.
Pansamantalang itatalaga ang mga miyembro ng NCRPO Regional Public Safety Battalion at Civil Disturbance Management sa Caloocan upang hindi mapilay ang operasyon ng PNP sa lungsod.
Dagdag pa ni Albayalde, isasailalim ang nasa 1,000 tauhan ng pulis Caloocan sa retraining.¬†
Samantala, dumulog naman si Lorena sa National Police Commission (NAPOLCOM) para magsampa ng mga kasong administratibo laban sa mga pulis na nanloob sa kanilang bahay.
"Gusto kong humingi ng hustisya kasi hanggang ngayon nandoon pa rin nerbiyos ko."
Ayon sa NAPOLCOM, malinaw sa CCTV ang paglabag ng mga pulis sa paggamit ng menor de edad sa kanilang operasyon.¬†

"Unnecessary exposure sa danger iyon 'pag may nangyari dahil di naman sila part ng operation. Pananagutan na naman ng PNP iyon," ani Attorney Rogelio Casurao, vice chairman at executive officer ng NAPOLCOM.
"Sa paggamit ng minor, parang wala na tayong pinagkaiba sa mga rebelde na gumagamit ng minors," ani Albayalde.
Matinding paglabag din umano ang pag-aarmas sa police asset at paggamit sa kanila para magnakaw.

Paliwanag ni Casurao: "Ang asset is supposed to provide only information, di sila dapat kasama. Sinasabi nila na di namin pwede expose ang asset kasi baka masunod at mapatay. Pinakamabigat niyan is dismissal from service or demotion in rank."

Para kay Lorena, kahit na nangangamba siya sa kanyang buhay, determinado siya na ilaban ang kaso. Dahil hindi lang ito para sa kanya kundi para na rin sa iba pang mga naging biktima ng pang-aabuso ng mga tiwaling pulis.
Matatandaang tatlong pulis-Caloocan din ang itinuturong may sala sa pagkakapaslang kay Kian delos Santos.
Dalawang pulis-Caloocan naman ang idinadawit sa pagpatay kay Carl Angelo Arnaiz.
-- Ulat nina Henry Atuelan at Dominic Almelor, ABS-CBN News

abs-cbn.title: Magkapatid na bata, patay sa sunog
content: Dalawang bata ang namatay sa sunog na sumiklab sa kanilang bahay sa Asturias, Cebu.
Kinilala ang mga biktima na sina Marilyn Faith Palicte, 5-taong gulang at ang 2-taong gulang na kapatid na si Mark France.
Ayon sa mga pulis, nasa trabaho umano ang magulang ng mga bata kaya ini-lock nila ang bahay.
Sabi naman sa mga bumbero na hindi nila mapuntahan ang bahay dahil nasa tuktok umano ito ng bundok.
Sa imbestigasyon, pinaglaruan daw ng mga bata ang lighter na pinagmulan ng sunog. ‚Äì Umagang kay Ganda, 15 September 2017

abs-cbn.title: God said 'not yet', Comelec's Bautista explains decision to stay
content: After a time of soul searching, Commission on Elections Chairman Andres Bautista on Friday said he believes he needs to stay on in the poll body - at least for now.¬†

"Patuloy ang aking pag-iisip at pagdarasal. Meron ako nabasa - God answers prayer in 3 ways, either yes, not yet or I have a better plan for you. Siguro yun nga, yung pagli-leave or pag re-resign parang ang sagot sa akin ay 'not yet.' Tignan po natin sa mga susunod na mga araw kung ano ang mangyayari. Again, patuoy po ang ating pagninilay-nilay kung ano ang dapat gawin," Bautista told radio DZMM.¬†
The poll chief earlier asked for more time to think and pray after accusations of unexplained wealth from his own estranged wife triggered calls for his resignation.¬†
In an interview, Patricia Bautista said she found passbooks and envelopes containing cash that allegedly belong to her husband.
Bautista has denied wrongdoing and accused his wife of extortion and having an affair.¬†
The House of Representatives justice committee is set to tackle on Tuesday an impeachment complaint filed against Bautista.¬†

abs-cbn.title: Bagong modus: Mobile drug den, nabuking
content: Nabisto ng mga pulis ang umano'y bagong modus operandi ng mga tulak at gumagamit ng droga sa Iloilo.
Ayon sa Philippine National Police, gumagamit na ang mga kawatan ng isang van na animo'y mobile drug den.
Pakay lang sana sa ikinasang buy-bust operation si Hamlin Querubin.
Pero inaresto rin ang 11 kasama nito matapos maaktuhang gumagamit ng droga sa sasakyan.
Ayon pa sa PNP, nagbabago ang modus operandi ng mga tulak dahil sa pinaigting na kampanya ng pamahalaan laban sa droga. ‚Äì Umagang kay Ganda, 15 September 2017

abs-cbn.title: 65 residente ng Caloocan, huli sa one time, big time operation
content: Umabot sa 65 na mga residente ang hinuli sa one time, big time operation ng pulis sa Caloocan City nitong Huwebes ng gabi.
Pinag-push up ang 40 residente ng Caloocan na nahuling umiinom ng alak sa pampublikong lugar at walang suot na damit pantaas.
Kasama sa mga dinala ng pulis sa prisinto ang 10 menor de edad na nasa labas pa ng bahay pagpatak ng 10 p.m. curfew.
Mas kaunti ito kumpara sa mga nahuli sa operasyon noong nakaraang linggo.
Matapos pangaralan, pinauwi rin ang mga lumabag sa ordinansa. Ang mga menor de edad naman, ipinasundo sa magulang o guardian.
Babala ng bagong hepe ng Caloocan Police na kung paulit-ulit ang paglabag ay mapipilitan silang magsampa ng kaso laban sa violators na nasa hustong edad at sa mga magulang ng menor de edad.
Pinaigting ng Caloocan Police ang pagpapatupad ng curfew matapos mamatay ang dalawang menor de edad sa magkahiwalay na police operation sa lungsod.
Kasama rin sa nahuli sa operation ang dalawang may standing arrest warrants at 13 tao na nahulihan ng iligal na droga. ‚Äì Umagang kay Ganda, 15 September 2017

abs-cbn.title: 4 na lalaki, nagsuntukan sa loob ng convenience store
content: Nakunan ng cellphone video ang rambulan sa pagitan ng apat na lalaki sa loob ng isang convenience store sa Nabua, Camarines Sur.

Sa video, makikita ang isang lalaki nakaputing jacket na halos inilalampaso na ang lalaking naka-t-shirt. Ang isa namang naka-itim na jacket kasuntukan ang isa pang lalaki hanggang makalabas sila ng tindahan.
Ang video ay kuha ng isang customer.
Ayon sa nakakita, nakapila ang apat na lalaki para magbayad bago ang insidente.¬†
Nakainom umano ang dalawa sa kanila at napag-initan ang magkapatid na naka-jacket.

Binatikos naman sa social media ang guwardiya na halata umanong umiwas sa gulo imbes na umawat. Pero depensa niya, sinubukan niyang umawat pero di niya kinaya kaya tumakbo na lang daw siya para tumawag ng pulis.
Hindi naman naka-record sa Nabua Police ang insidente dahil wala na umano silang inabutan sa lugar. ‚Äì Umagang kay Ganda, 15 September 2017

abs-cbn.title: Sekyu sinaksak ang homeowner sa Bacoor subdivision
content: Pinaghahanap ngayon ang isang guwardiya ng subdivision sa Bacoor, Cavite matapos niyang pagsasaksakin at mapatay ang isang homeowner na nakaaway nila sa rambol na huli sa CCTV. - Umagang Kay Ganda, ika-15 ng Setyembre 2017.

abs-cbn.title: 3 magbabalut, pinagbabaril ng riding in tandem
content: Patay ang tatlong nagtitinda ng balut nang pagbabarilin ng riding in tandem sa Barangay San Isidro sa Antipolo. - Umagang Kay Ganda, ika-15 ng Setyembre 2017

abs-cbn.title: Grade 5 pupil na tulak umano ng marijuana, arestado
content: DAVAO CITY - Inaresto ng Sta. Ana Police ang isang menor de edad na lalaki matapos ito makunan ng marijuana buy-bust na isinagawa sa bahay ng suspek sa Barangay 24, Huwebes ng gabi.
Apat na maliit na balot ng marijuana na nagkakahalaga ng P1,000 ang narecover ng kapulisan sa suspek na Grade 5 pupil ngayon sa Rizal Elementary School dito sa lungsod.
Ayon sa menor de edad, sa Lupon, Davao Oriental 'di umano ang pinagkuhanan ng mga marijuana.
Depensa nito, hindi siya tulak ng marijuana, kundi kumukonsumo lamang ng ipinagbabawal na droga.
"Nagkataon lang talaga, Ma'am, konsumo ko lang naman 'yun. Pangpa-relax ko lang. Nagsisisi talaga ako," saad ng suspek.

Haharap sa kasong paglabag sa Republic Act 9165 o Comprehensive Dangerous Drugs Act of 2002 ang suspek pero dahil menor de edad pa ito, ituturn-over siya sa Department of Social Welfare and Development.

"Mag-undergo pa siya ng discernment. Kung mapatunayan na marunong na siyang mag-discern sa tama o mali, kakasuhan pa rin siya pero sa DSWD na siya," ani C/Insp. Alfred Rubrico, Deputy Commander ng Sta. Ana Police.
Isinailalim din sa drug test ang nasabing menor de edad.

abs-cbn.title: Kidnapped Indian found dead; 2 suspects killed
content: The Philippine National Police-Anti Kidnapping Group (PNP-AKG) has recovered the body an Indian national who was kidnapped and killed by a kidnap-for-ransom group in Cavite.¬†
LaIit Kumar was reported missing last September 3 while making his round of collections in Damari√±as, Cavite. The victim waskidnapped by three Filipino men.
Kumar's family went to the PNP-AKG to ask for help.¬†

Senior Supt. Glenn Dumlao, director of the PNP-AKG, said, "May family communicator na in-assign ang pamilya which is yung misis. From P20-million ransom initial demand, na pababa ng P10 million, then bumaba sila ng P1 million initial. Ganon naman ang mga Indian, nag-iinitial muna then hihingi ulit. So initial P1 million, tumawad dahil ang kinaya P680,000."¬†
Lalit Kumar's last proof of life was September 10.¬†
On Wednesday, a ransom payoff pushed through in Dasmari√±as, Cavite.¬†

"Kinover natin ang family sa pagbibigay ng pera and maghapon yun and hanggang finally kaninang madaling-araw lang nila tinanggap 'yung dalawang Indian national, Honey Deol at Kumar Pardeep sila ang kumuha ng ransom," Dumlao said.¬†

The suspects identified as Honey Singh alias Honey Deol and Kumar Pardeep were killed during an armed encounter with PNP-AKG operatives. Recovered from the suspects were guns and the ransom payment.¬†

"Nung pinupursue na natin sila para possible na malocate yung safehouse para ma-locate ang victim siguro naka-sense sila at nakipagpalitan sila ng putok. Unfortunately too, nalaman natin na si Kumar ay pinatay pa noong September 11," Dumlao said.¬†
Kumar's body was found dumped in Barangay Navarro, General Trias, Cavite.¬†
According to Dumlao, Kumar's kidnappers were connected to a kidnap-for-ransom group encountered by police in Sta. Rosa, Laguna.¬†

"Yung kidnapping sa Sta. Rosa Laguna, connected sila doon and so with the Filipinos, same modus 'yon. Umuupa sila ng van na gagamitin, hindi ibabalik ang van. Palaging nangingidnap ay mga Pinoy na umaaktong pulis o NBI then ibibigay na sa mga Indian for the negotiation," he said.¬†

Authorities are now looking for the three Filipinos tagged in Kumar's kidnapping and death.¬†
¬†

content: Arestado ang isang Malaysian at 19 na Pilipino matapos salakayin ng Philippine National Police Anti-Cybercrime Group ang isang online gambling operation sa Pasig. Nagpa-Patrol, Maan Macapagal. TV Patrol, Huwebes, 14 Setyembre 2017

Giit pa ng CHR, mali ang Kamara sa pag-intindi sa mandato ng kanilang ahensiya. Nagpa-Patrol, Ron Gagalac. TV Patrol, Huwebes, 14 Setyembre 2017.

abs-cbn.title: 2 pulis-Caloocan at taxi driver na idinawit sa pagkasawi nina Carl at 'Kulot', kinasuhan ng murder

Sinampahan na ng mga kasong double murder, torture, at planting of evidence ang dalawang pulis-Caloocan kaugnay sa pagpatay kina Carl Angelo Arnaiz at Reynaldo de Guzman. abs-cbn.title: 2 'supplier ng ilegal na droga', patay sa buy-bust sa Bulacan
content: Patay sa buy-bust operation ang dalawang itinuturong supplier ng ilegal na droga sa San Rafael Bulacan at sa mga katabing bayan. Arestado naman ang limang iba pa sa magkakahiwalay na drug operations. Nagpa-Patrol, Doland Castro. TV Patrol, Huwebes, 14 Setyembre 2017

abs-cbn.title: 'Mga sumuporta sa P1,000 CHR budget, maaaring singilin sa halalan'
content: Nakatakdang humarap muli ang Pilipinas sa United Nations Human Rights Council sa Geneva, Switzerland sa susunod na linggo upang pormal na ipaalam kung tinatanggap nito ang mga panukala ng konseho kaugnay sa giyera kontra ilegal na droga ng administrasyon.
Inaasahang tututukan din sa universal periodic review ng Pilipinas sa susunod na linggo ang tuloy-tuloy na patayan sa kabila ng babala ng United Nations.
Ayon din sa naging rekomendasyon noon ng mga ibang bansa tulad ng Spain, Cuba, Costa Rica, at Australia, dapat anilang palakasin ng Pilipinas ang Commission on Human Rights (CHR).
Pero taliwas ito sa naging desisyon na ginawa ng Kamara noong Martes, Setyembre 12.
Lumabas kasi na P1,000 lang ang halaga ng inilaang pondo para sa komisyon sa ilalim ni Pangulong Duterte.
Kasunod nito ay inulan ng batikos ang mga kongresistang sumuporta rito.
Maging ang mga hindi sumipot noong gabi ng botohan, hindi rin nakaligtas.
Ang mga kongresistang pumabor sa P1,000 pondo ng CHR, maaari umanong singilin sa susunod na halalan, ayon kay Ramon Casiple, executive director ng Institute for Political and Electoral Reform.
Dagdag ni CHR Commissioner Karen Dumpit, isang "international embarrassment" ang nangyari.¬†
Naniniwala si Dumpit na maaaprubahan din kalaunan ang panukalang pondo ng CHR na mahigit P600 milyong piso.
Nitong Huwebes, Setyembre 14, hiniling ng isang grupo ng human rights lawyers na magpatak-patak ang publiko para makalikom ng sapat na pondo para sa CHR.

Isinusulong naman ni Senador Bam Aquino ang ‚ÄúPeople's Fund‚Äù bill na nagbibigay kalayaan sa mga taxpayer na mamili kung aling ahensiya ng gobyerno mapupunta ang porsiyento ng kanilang binabayarang buwis.
Ayon sa panukala, maaaring ilaan ang 5% ng kabuuang binabayarang buwis sa CHR.
Nagpahayag din ng pagkabahala ang European Chamber of Commerce of the Philippines sa sinapit ng ahensiya.
Hindi raw kasi maganda ang ipinahihiwatig sa ibang bansa ng kakarampot na budget para sa isang departamentong nagbabantay sa karapatang pantao.
Nararapat din daw na tiyaking nirerespeto ng bansa ang karapatang pantao ng mga mamamayan nito.
Pero ayon kay Budget Secretary Benjamin Diokno, hindi naman na-"zero" ang pondo ng CHR kaya puwede pa itong madagdagan dahil hindi pa naman pasado ang panukalang 2018 National Budget.
Nagsisilbi lamang itong mensahe para sa ahensiya, ayon pa kay Diokno.
Para sa ahensiya, maliwanag na gusto lang silang patahimikin at gawing sunud-sunuran ng kasalukuyang administrasyon.
-- Ulat ni Christian Esguerra, ABS-CBN News

abs-cbn.title: Pondong tinapyas mula sa CHR, ilalaan umano sa libreng matrikula
content: Balak ilipat ang dapat sana'y pondo ng Commission on Human Rights (CHR), Energy Regulatory Commission (ERC), at National Commission on Indigenous Peoples (NCIP) sa pondo ng pamahalaan para sa libreng edukasyon sa kolehiyo.
Ayon kay House Appropriations Committee Chairperson Karlo Nograles, naghahanap din kasi ng pondo ang pamahalaan para sa libreng matrikula sa state universities at colleges.
Tanging P1,000 ang pondong inaprubahan ng Kamara para sa tatlong nabanggit na ahensiya.
Dagdag ni Nograles, maaari namang humingi ang mga ahensiya ng karagdagang pondo mula sa Palasyo.
Pero tutol ang ilang grupo at mambabatas na ilipat ang pondo ng mga nasabing ahensiya sa libreng edukasyon.
Sa pahayag ng Gabriela Party-list, sinabi nitong maaring kumuha na lang ng pondo sa iba pang proyekto gaya ng Oplan Double Barrel at Masa Masid upang matustusan ang kakulangan sa pangmatrikula.
Ayon kay Akbayan Party-list Rep. Tom Villarin, hindi sagot ang pagbawas sa pondo ng isang constitutional body para makaiwas sa pamumuna.
Walang opisyal na listahan
Kumalat sa Kamara at social media ang iba't ibang listahan ng mga mambabatas na nanindigan para sa CHR.
Subalit walang kasiguraduhan ang mga umiikot na listahan.
Dahil hindi nominal voting o pormal na pagtatala ng pangalan sa botohan, walang opisyal na listahan kung sino-sino ang bumotong pabor at kontra sa budget ng CHR.
Wala ring nais umamin sa 119 na mambabatas na sumang-ayon sa P1,000 budget.
Sa 294 miyembro ng mababang kapulungan, 236 ang naroroon sa Session Hall bago magbotohan, ngunit 151 lang ang naitalang bilang ng mga bumoto.
Ibig sabihin, may mahigit 80 kongresista ang wala sa sesyon noong botohan.
Kabilang sa mga nagpahayag na hindi kasama sa botohan sina Cibac Party-list Rep. Sherwin Tugna at Ifugao Rep. Teddy Baguilat.
Sa Twitter ng anak na si Luis Manzano ipinadaan ni Batangas Representative Vilma Santos ang kaniyang pagtutol na alisan ng pondo ang CHR.¬†
Si Muntinlupa Rep. Ruffy Biazon, nakaalis na ng Kamara bago pa man mangyari ang umano'y biglaan na botohan.
Pagtapyas sa pondo ng CHR ang isa sa mga nabanggit na dahilan ng Makabayan bloc sa pagkalas nila sa maryorya ng Kamara.
Alvarez, minura ang mga kritiko
Minura naman ni House Speaker Pantaleon Alvarez ang mga nagsasabing Kamara ang dapat alisan ng pondo sa halip na CHR.
Sa panayam kay Alvarez ng programang "Failon Ngayon" ng DZMM, tiniyak ng House Speaker na paninindigan ng Kamara ang P1,000 pondo ng CHR sa bicameral conference committee para sa 2018 budget.
Binitawan ni Alvarez ang mga pahayag matapos tutulan ng ilang miyembro ng Senado ang P1,000 budget.
Mayroon din mula sa ehekutibong sangay ang kumontra sa Kamara, kabilang si Defense Secretary Delfin Lorenzana.
Nilinaw din ng Palasyo na wala silang balak kontrolin ang mga ahensiyang kumokontra sa administrasyon.
Nakatakdang pagbotohan ng Kamara sa ikatlo at huling pagbasa ang panukalang 2018 budget sa susunod na linggo.
-- Ulat ni RG Cruz, ABS-CBN News

abs-cbn.title: Topacio to revise Bautista impeachment complaint
content: MANILA- Lawyer Ferdinand Topacio on Thursday said his camp will amend the impeachment complaint they submitted against Commission on Elections (Comelec) Chairman Andres Bautista after House Majority Leader Rodolfo Fari√±as pointed out a defective verification page.

The complaint filed against Bautista used the same verification page format similar to the dismissed impeachment complaint of Dante Jimenez and Eligio Mallari against Chief Justice Maria Lourdes Sereno.
The said complaint against Sereno was found insufficient in form by the House Committee on Justice for the defective verification page.
"Aayusin po natin yan para wala silang masabi sa sufficiency in substance and form," Topacio said.
"It was probably an error in nomenclature syntax‚Ä¶Nandoon po, nakadikit naman authentic documents kay Chairman Bautista including affidavits sworn to by the wife," he added.

Topacio, together with lawyer Manuelito Luna, and former Negros Oriental Rep. Jacinto Paras filed ouster raps against the poll chief on allegations that the latter misdeclared his wealth in his Statement of Assets and Liabilities Net Worth (SALN).
The complaint was endorsed by Deputy Speaker Gwen Garcia, Kabayan Rep. Harry Roque, and Cavite Rep. Abraham Tolentino.
House Justice Committee Chair Rey Umali meanwhile said the body will still have to decide if it will allow an amendment since the complaint has already been referred to the committee.¬†

Topacio maintained that their complaint against Bautista is similar to the complaint of lawyer Lorenzo Gadon against Sereno which has advanced in the justice committee since it has certified true copies of documents.

abs-cbn.title: 'Pagbibitiw ni Gascon sa CHR kapalit ng budget, hindi katanggap-tanggap'
content: Ayon kay Atty. Tony La Vi√±a, hindi katanggap-tanggap ang kondisyon na magbitiw si Commission on Human Rights (CHR) chairman Chito Gascon kapalit ng pagbabalik ng orihinal na budget ng ahensiya.

"Hindi acceptable 'yan kasi ang ibig sabihin dyan magkakaroon ka ng isang CHR na hindi independent. Kung mayroon siyang ginawa na labag sa batas, dapat file-an siya ng charges," ani La Vi√±a, dating dean ng Ateneo School of Government. - Bandila sa DZMM, Huwebes, 14 Setyembre, 2017
